loans.name: Buena Fe Group

texts.es:
Buena Fe se formó en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es un grupo muy unido, que decidieron poder trabajar juntas para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como un medio de poder conocer su situación de vida e ir mejorándola.
La Sra. Monica es una de las integrantes, quien a través del esfuerzo y por medio de su pequeño negocio que es un copetín, se ha abierto camino y da a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener. Monica es una mujer muy sacrificada, que todos los días empieza su jornada desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde en la noche.
La Señora  Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar productos para su copetín, como ser comestibles, bebidas, yogur, galletitas y otros,  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Buena Fe was formed in the city of San Lorenzo, they are a very united group, who decided to work together to improve their quality of life and that of their families. They are doing the poverty elimination survey as a means of getting to know their situation in life and go about improving it. 

Mrs. Monica is one of the members who through hard work and through her small business which is a snack bar she has been able to make headway and give her family everything that she couldn’t have.  Monica is very selfless; she starts all her workdays very early in the morning and goes on until very late in the night.

She is requesting this loan to buy products for her snack bar such as comestibles, drinks, yogurts, cookies and other items. This will help her solidify her business plan which will help increases her earnings.

loans.use: to buy comestibles, drinks, yogurts, cookies and other items

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old, married and has five children who are all currently in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shania Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado tres mujeres de la etnia Miskita Marlene que tiene una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda de tambo de madera, Ninska Ivannia y Marisol María venden accesorios de plata de manera ambulante.   Luchan cada día para mejorar sus pequeños negocios y de esta manera brindarles un mejor bienestar a sus familias.  Se organizaron hace un año, con el propósito de accesar a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Marisol María: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer cordial, casada, tiene 34 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos  adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de accesorios de plata, acero y oro laminado de manera ambulante. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: pulseras, cadenas, aretes, anillos, dijes, brazaletes, entre otros accesorios, así incrementar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con tener una tienda y vitrinas para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three ethnic Miskita women: Marlene, who has a small, convenience store in her wooden, stilt home; Ninska Ivannia and Marisol María sell silver accessories door-to-door. They struggle every day to improve their small businesses so they can improve the well-being of their families. The got together a year ago for the purpose of accessing guaranteed solidarity loans in Pana Pana. 

Marisol María is a member of the solidarity group. She is a cordial, 34-year-old woman, married, and the single mother of 3 teenage children who are in elementary and high school. In order to help her children get ahead, 2 years ago she began selling silver, steel and gold laminated accessories door-to-door. She is requesting financing to buy bracelets, chains, earrings, rings, charms, bangles and cuffs, and other accessories in Managua so she can increase her income. She dreams of one day having a store and display cases to exhibit her products.

loans.use: To buy bracelets, chains, earrings, rings, charms, bangles and cuffs, and other accessories in Managua.

loans.name: Kumarbubu

texts.ru: Кумарбубу, 52 года, замужем, она мать 5 детей. У Кумарбубу среднее образование, она на пенсии, на протяжении 19 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. В хозяйстве Кумарбубу есть 3 коровы и 30 овец. На участке мерою 2,4 Га она выращивает фасоль. Также на ежедневной основе продает молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль Кумарбубу составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) с целью развития ее бизнеса, а именно, на запрошенную сумму Кумарбубу планирует приобрести овец и корм для скота. Доходы от кредита Кумарбубу будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку нового дома.
texts.en:
Kumarbubu is 52 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Kumarbubu has a secondary education. She is retired. For the last 19 years, she has been raising livestock and crops. On Kumarbubu's homestead, she has three cows and 30 sheep. On a plot of land measuring 2.4 hectares, she grows beans. She also sells milk on a daily basis. Kumarbubu's monthly profits amount to about 18,000 som (KGS). She applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) with the aim of developing her business, and specifically, Kumarbubu plans with the requested sum to purchase sheep and livestock feed.

Kumarbubu will invest income from the loan in further developing her business and to build a new home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep and livestock feed in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Amor Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está integrado por 3 mujeres de la etnia miskita, con una visión de progreso: Adela Adayla y Karla Porla tienen una pequeña pulpería en sus viviendas de tambo de madera y Thelma vende bastimento. Se organizaron hace un año, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana  y mejorar sus condiciones de vida e incrementar su nivel de ingresos. Decidieron llamar al grupo solidario AMOR, porque trabajan de manera unida, en armonía, para poder hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. 

Adela Adayla: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, con cualidades de líder, casada, tiene  tres hijos: Uno mayor de edad e independiente y dos adolescentes que estudian su primaria en una escuela pública de Bilwi. Desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería donde ofrece productos de uso para el hogar, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos para surtir su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con llegar a tener una comideria
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 women of the Miskita ethnic group who have a vision of progress. Adela Adayla and Karla Porla operate a small general store out of their wooden stilt homes, and Thelma sells staple goods. They got together a year ago with the purpose of working together as a group to have access to solidarity loans from Pana Pana to improve their living conditions and increase their income level. 

They decided to call their solidarity group AMOR [which means love], because they work united and in harmony to be able to grow their small businesses and help with household expenses. 

Adela Adayla is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is an amiable woman, with leadership qualities. She is married with three children. One is grown and independent, and two are teenagers studying at a small Bilwi public primary school. Three years ago she opened a small grocery store where she offers household goods, generating her own income to contribute to household expenses and to her children's studies.

 She is requesting a loan to buy more products to stock her business and thus increase her income. She dreams of having an eatery.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and snacks.

loans.name: Suiunbubu

texts.ru: Суйунбубу 59 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. У Суйунбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Суйунбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 30 овец. На участке мерою 3,0 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Суйунбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец и 1 коровы. Доходы от кредита Суйунбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Suiunbubu is 59 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Suiunbubu has a secondary education. As a main source of income for the family, she raises livestock, having begun 20 years ago with a livestock purchase of 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Suiunbubu currently has on her farm: two cows, 30 sheep. On a plot of land measuring 3.0 hectares, she grows beans for sale. With the aim of further developing her farm, Suiunbubu applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase 20 sheep and one cow.

Suiunbubu plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals and plans to save money to build a barn for the animals.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep and one cow to increase the headcount of livestock on her farm.

loans.name: Aselkan

texts.ru: Аселкан 51 год, замужем, мать 3 детей, все активно помогают по хозяйству. Аселкан работает учителем, также занимается сельским хозяйством с 2008 года. На сегодня в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Аселкан составляет в среднем 8,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 овец, 40 тюков сена и 10 кг. жмыха, в качестве корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Аселкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Aselkan is 51 years old, married, and the mother of three children, all who actively help around the homestead. Aselkan works as a teacher and also is involved in agriculture since 2008. Currently, she has three cows and one horse on her homestead. Monthly income from Aselkan's business amounts to an average 8,000 som (KGS). She applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to purchase four sheep, 40 bales of hay and 10 kg of oilcakes as feed for the livestock.

Aselkan plans to invest income from the loan in further developing her business and wants to save money for home repair.

loans.use: to buy four sheep, 40 bales of hay, and 10 kg of oilcake as a feed for livestock.

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL MILAGROS DE DIOS ESTA CONFORMADA POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE  QUINCE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, ESTE LUGAR SE CARACTERIZA POR  LA PRODUCCIÓN DE PRODUCTOS LÁCTEOS COMO LECHE, CUAJADA, QUESO EL CUAL ES UNA FUENTE IMPORTANTES DE INGRESOS PARA LA COMUNIDAD. ESTAS PERSONAS TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS, LA CUAL ES SU FUENTES DE INGRESOS PARA SUS FAMILIAS, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON  EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAR A TEMPRANA EDAD. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SALIR ADELANTE CON SUS HIJOS Y BRINDARLES MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA, YA QUE ES UNO DE SUS MAYORES SUEÑOS FORMAR A SUS HIJOS EN PROFESIONALES.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES  PRICILA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA ELABORACIÓN Y VENTA DE PAN, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN,  LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE PRICILA ES DE UNAS DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO  ELABORANDO Y OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS COMO;  POLVOROS, BIZCOTELAS, CACHOS, PICOS, EMPANADAS, RIN, TORTA DE PILLAS, PAN SIMPLES ETC. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO ES EL PAN, PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. MILAGRO DE DIOS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Milagros de Dios community group is made up of nine members who are mothers and fathers responsible for 15 children in their care.  They are originally from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the region, which is known for the production of dairy products like milk, cottage cheese, and cheeses.  This is an important source of income for the community.  The group members work in different areas which are a source of income for their families.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they could not attend school and needed to start working at a young age.  Currently, they fight for their children to succeed and to be able to provide them with better opportunities in life.  One of their main dreams is to have their children become professionals.

Thanks to her efforts to succeed, the group coordinator is Pricila.  She works making and selling bread.  Her business is located in her home.  Pricila's work routine is to spend ten hours a day making and offering her products, including cookies, bizcotela [a type of bread covered in sugar], croissants, pastries, empanadas, rin bread, cakes, rolls, and other items.  She will use this loan to invest in working capital and stock her business to buy and sell bread so that in the near future she can earn more income.  

The Milagro de Dios group is grateful for the help provided by the Kiva lenders to people with few resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have a dignified way of working.

loans.use: to make and sell croissants, pastries, bizcotelas, rolls, cakes, cookies, and other items.

loans.name: Kade's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Mai 2011,est constitué de 19 membres qui habitent tous dans la même localité.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Ragui,se trouvant debout a droite de la photo et levant le bras, est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle est une veuve et mére de quatre enfants.Elle effectue le commerce comme activité principale.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter 10 sacs de pain de singe à 3500f le sac,03 sceaux de 15kg de patte d'arachide à 16500f le sceau, un sac de 100kg de fonio à 60000f et le reste pour les frais de transport.

Pour son bénéfice,elle compte développer son activités et subvenir a ces besoins.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2011 and is composed of 19 members, all living in the same town. Their main work involves commerce. 

Ragui, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is our featured borrower. She is a widow and a mother of four. She buys and sells goods as her main activity. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase ten sacks of monkey bread [the fruit of the baobab tree] at 3,500 francs per sack; three 15-kg pails of peanut butter at 16,500 francs per pail; and a 100-kg sack of fonio [a type of millet] at 60,000 francs. The rest is for transport costs. 

With the profits, she plans on developing her business and supporting herself.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Aiymkan

texts.ru: Айымкан успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Айымкан на сегодняшний день есть 3 коровы, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячная прибыль Айымкан составляет до 10,000 сом(KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Айымкан. Ее младший сын со своей семьей живет с Айымкан. В целях дальнейшего развития и увеличения прибыли от ведения бизнеса Айымкан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы от бизнеса Айымкан планирует откладывать на свое лечение.
texts.en:
Aiymkan successfully repaid her loan. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with financing. On her homestead, Aiymkan currently has three cows and one horse. Aiymkan's monthly profits amount to 10,000 som (KGS). These funds are sorely lacking for a decent life for Aiymkan. Her younger son and his family live with Aiymkan.

With the aim of further developing and increasing profits from conducting her business, Aiymkan applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to purchase two cows.

With the income from the loan, Aiymkan plans to continue her medical treatment.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her profits and save for her treatment.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a 22-year-old woman who successfully runs her own market store, as well as volunteering her time to give back to her community. Tatu volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to students in the local secondary school. Through her lessons, she encourages students to find their own strengths, and to think about how to create a better world. 

Tatu’s business involves running a busy market store where she sells tomatoes. She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to expand her business, primarily by increasing her tomato stock and by buying onions to diversify and generate enough profit. 

Tatu plans to use her profits from the loan to cover crucial household expenses. The interest on Tatu’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two-and-a-half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s work with younger students.

loans.use: to expand her business, primarily by increasing her tomato stock and by buying onions

loans.name: Ziada

texts.en:
Ziada is a hard-working 21-year-old tailor and volunteer teacher. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she teaches life skills to younger students in the community. Through her lessons, Ziada encourages students to find their own strengths, and to think about how to create a better world.

As a businesswoman, Ziada is a successful tailor of women’s clothes, but she is in need of a sewing machine. By buying one with a Kiva loan, she hopes to expand her business and generate more profit. With these profits, Ziada hopes to cover important household expenses. The interest on Ziada’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two-and-a-half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s work with younger students.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying a sewing machine and generate more profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a small market stall selling vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her cosmetic shop into a salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business of selling women’s and children’s clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables and to expand her business.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар проживает в городке под названием Куляб. Ей 34 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Одна дочка в возрасте 6 лет. Сыновья еще маленькие, они в возрасте 4 лет, и 9 месяцев. Ее муж находится на заработках за границей, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить семью. У Санавбар была мечта научиться мастерству кройки и шитья женской одежды, чтобы начать новую деятельность и зарабатывать на жизнь. Благодаря маме она научилась этому ремеслу и теперь хотела бы начать свое швейное дело. Однако чтобы начать новый бизнес ей необходимо купить швейную машинку. Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась за кредитом, за счет которого собирается приобрести электронную швейную машинку, а также другие швейные принадлежности. Вы можете поддержать Санавбар и она надеется на Вас. С помощью кредита она будет иметь работу и постоянный доход, что позволит улучшить финансовое положение их семьи.
texts.en: Sanavbar resides in a town called Kulyab. She is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her one daughter is six years old, and her sons are still small at the ages of four years and nine months. Her huband is working abroad to make a living and support the family. Sanavbar had a dream to learn the skill of cutting and sewing women's clothing to start a new career and earn a living. Thanks to her mother, she learned this craft and now would like to start her own sewing business. However, in order to start a new business she needs to buy a sewing machine. Because of insufficient funds, she applied for a loan, by which she intends to purchase an electronic sewing machine and also other sewing implements. With the help of a loan, she will have work and ongoing income that will allow her to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine in order to start new activities.

loans.name: Musfira

texts.ru: Мусфира свободная женщина в возрасте 30 лет. Она живет вместе с родителями и братьями. Мусфира 4 года работает в сфере торговли. Она на местном рынке занимается продажей тканей и женской одежды, таким образом, она обеспечивает семью. Мусфира любит свою работу и хочет дальше продвигаться в данной сфере деятельности. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Мусфира хочет за счет денежных средств увеличить товарооборот и расширить деятельность.
texts.en: Musfira is 30 and single. She lives with her parents and brothers and has been working in retail for four years. She sells fabric and women's clothing at the local market and in such a way provides for her family. She loves her work and wants to move further in this area of business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan. She wants to use the loan amount to increase her working capital and expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital in her clothing and fabric shop

loans.name: Khayriyyah

texts.en:
Khayriyyah is a 57 year old married woman from Dora, a village near Hebron city. She lives with her old husband and four children; two sons and two daughters. Her sons are workers where they receive a low income. Khayriyyah has been working in the sewing business for the past ten years. It is a very good business but the income is low. 
Khayriyyah rook a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop. This will improve her work quality. 
Khayriyyah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Banco Comunal Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL CORAZÓN DE JESUS ESTA CONFORMADA POR INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON VEINTE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIAS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL,  SON MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS CON DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS,  LAS CUALES SON PROVEEDORAS PARA SUS FAMILIAS.  LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON OBLIGADAS A TRABAJAR DESDE TEMPRANA EDAD, PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS PERSEVERANCIA Y SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES LIDUVINA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA  ELABORACIÓN  Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA REALIZA EN SUS CASA DE HABITACIÓN DESDE HACE DIEZ AÑOS  LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE LIDUVINA ES DE UNA DIES HORAS DIARIAS SE LEVANTA DESDE LAS 4: AM A NISKESAR, MOLER, PALMERA LAS TORTILLAS PARA SU DEBIDA ENTREGA Y VENTA DE LAS MISMA, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA REALIZA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE EL SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. CON EL CREDITO ELLA NECESITA INVERTIR EN MAÍZ, LEÑA, CAL, COMALES, BOLSAS, PLÁSTICAS, DELANTAL, ETC.  CORAZÓN DE JESUS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal bank Corazón de Jesus is made up of members who are single mothers responsible for twenty children. They are native to El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region. They are known for being hard workers, responsible, with the desire for self-improvement. They are entrepreneurial women with different economic activities, who are providers for their families. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, they were not able to study and they saw themselves as obligated to work from an early age to help with the home expenses.

Thanks to her perseverance and desire to come out ahead, the coordinator is Liduvina. Her economic activity is the production and sale of tortillas, an activity that she has carried out in her home for ten years. Liduvina’s work routine is one of ten hours a day. She wakes up at 4 a.m. to mix, grind, and pat the tortillas for the correct delivery and sale of the same. She carries out this activity very gladly since it is her family’s support. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in work capital and supply her business, from which in a not-very-far future she hopes to be able to make a higher income. With the loan, she needs to invest in corn, firewood, lime, griddles, bags, plastic ware, an apron, etc. Corazón de Jesus is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and from poor countries such as Nicaragua in order for them to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in primary materials for the production of tortillas, such as corn, firewood, lime, griddles, bags, plasticware, an apron, etc.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is a 32-year-old married woman who is running her own successful tailoring business. On top of this, Sifa is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering in her ward secondary school to teach life skills to students. Her lessons focus on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence. 

Sifa is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to expand her business with the purchase of a new sewing machine. The profits this would bring could help her to cover vital household expenses for her family. The interest on Sifa’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s work with younger students.

loans.use: to expand her business with the purchase of a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.ru: Ее зовут Хурматой. Ей 42 года. Она проживает на районе Яван вместе с двумя детьми. Старшему сыну 17 лет. Он является разнорабочим. Его сын чувствует ответственность за свою мать и 7 месячного братишки. Хурматой недавно стала мамой во второй раз. Хурматой работает медсестрой и сейчас она находиться в декретном отпуске. Она прекрасно справляется с ребенком и у нее остается времени для других дел. Хурматой умеет шить женскую одежду, и она хочет купить швейную машинку, чтобы принимать заказы на шитье. Ей не хватает средств для совершения данной покупки Хурматой обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести машинку. Она заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en: Her name is Hurmatoy. She is 42 years old. She resides in the Yavan region with her two children. The elder son is 17 years old. He is a laborer. Her son feels responsibility for his mother and seven-month-old brother. Hurmatoy recently became a mother for the second time. Hurmatoy works as a nurse and now she is on maternity leave. She takes good care of her infant and there remains time for other activities. Hurmatoy knows how to sew women's clothing and she wants to buy a sewing machine in order to take orders for sewing. Since she does not have enough resources to complete the purchase, Hurmatoy applied for a loan  to acquire a machine. She expresses her gratitude in advance for the help.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Tojidin

texts.ru: Это Точидин. Молодой житель города Душанбе. Ему 36 лет. Он женат и у него две дочери. Дочкам 6 и 2 лет. Точидин честный и добрый человек. Он хочет начать новый бизнес, заниматься поваром. У него есть столовое, который он хочет начать деятельность. Для старта нового бизнеса ему надо купить кухонный принадлежности и стол стульев.  У Точидин не  хватает  денежных средств, по этой причине он обратился за кредитом. С помощью этого кредита Точидин может начать свой бизнес. Точидин верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This is Tojidin. He is a young resident of the city of Dushanbe. He is 36 years old, married, and has two daughters, aged two and six. Tojidin is an honest and kind person. He wants to start a new business engaged as a cook. He has a dining hall, in which he wants to begin activities. To start the new business, he needs to buy kitchen appliances, tables, and chairs. Tojidin does not have money for this purpose and he applied for a loan. With the help of this loan, Tojidin can start his business.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen appliances, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru:
Фахриддин молодой житель не большого района Вахш. Ему 30 лет. Он работает таксистом. Фахриддин женат и имеет троих детей. У него трое замечательных сыновей, которым 8, 6 и 2 годика. Жена домохозяйка, она следит за детьми и за порядком в доме. 
  Причина обращения Фахриддина является в том, что у Фахриддина есть племянник. Он учиться платно в Университете города Курган-Тюбе. Он очень старательный мальчик. Фахриддин видит, как он старается, и хочет, чтобы его племянник получил высшее образование и устроился на хорошую работу. Фахриддин хочет ему помочь и оплатить учебный контракт, и поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Племянник не в состоянии самостоятельно оплатить свою учебу. Фахриддин надеется, что найдутся люди, которые помогут им и племянник далее продолжить учебу.
texts.en:
Fakhriddin is a young resident of the small region of Vakhsh. He is 30 years old. He works as a taxi driver. Fakhriddin is married and has three children. He has three great sons, who are 8, 6 and 2 years old. His wife is a homemaker; she looks after the children and keeps order in the house.

The reason for Fakhriddin's request is that he has a nephew. He is enrolled in the University in the city of Kurgan-Tyube. He is a very studious boy. Fakhriddin sees how he strives and wants for his nephew to receive a higher education and to build a good career. Fakhriddin wants to help him and to pay his tuition, and therefore he is requesting a loan. His nephew is not in a position to pay for his schooling himself. Fakhriddin hopes that there will be people who will help him and his nephew to continue the boy's studies.

loans.use: to pay his nephew's tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business selling soft drinks

loans.name: Multietnicas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres de la etnia miskita, razón por la cual decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario MULTIETNICAS: Irma Isabel, Maria Hermnegilda y Yolanda, tienen una pequeña pulpería en sus viviendas de tambo de madera. Se unieron hace 3 años con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de sus familias.

Yolanda: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre y amable, originaria de Waspam, se trasladó a Puerto Cabezas, hace 4 años, con el propósito de establecer su propia fuente de ingresos, después de quedar viuda. Tiene 62 años de edad, con tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda de tambo de madera, que ha construido poco a poco con gran esfuerzo, donde vende productos básicos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chivería, sopas instantáneas, pan, huevo, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con construir su vivienda de concreto (cemento), ya que es de mayor seguridad y durabilidad.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 women who are ethnically Miskita, the reason for which they decided to name their solidarity group Multietnicas: Irma Isabel, Maria Hermnegilda, and Yolanda. They have a small grocery store in their homes on wooden stilts. The got together three years ago with the goal of working in a supportive way to have access to loans in Pana Pana and to have the opportunity to improve their incomes and the quality of life of their families.

Yolanda is a component of the solidarity group. She is a happy and kind woman, native to Waspam. She relocated to Puerto Cabezas 4 years ago with the intention of establishing her own source of income after becoming a widow. She is 62 years old, with three children who are older and independent. Three years ago she opened a small grocery store in her home on wooden stilts, that she had constructed little by little with great effort, where she sells basic products. She dreams of constructing a cement home since this provides greater security and durability.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, snacks, instant soups, bread, and eggs, among other products.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edna is 34 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Edna has a general store business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Edna has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, 33 years old, is a businesswoman and a mother of two. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life-skills to students in the local secondary school. 

Mariam owns a shop from which she sells cold drinks and she is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to expand her business and to send her children to school. Mariam believes that a Kiva loan will change her life. 

The interest on her loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to support her business by increasing her stock of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара проживает в районе Вахш с мужем и детьми. Она мать четверых детей. У нее двое дочери и два сыновей. Ей 46 лет. Ее муж занимается разнорабочим, он каждый год ездит в России, чтобы зарабатывать деньги на жизнь. Гулсара занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота 10 лет. У нее есть коровник, где она заботится о своих животных. Она покупает крупнорогатого скота, откармливают их несколько месяцев, и потом вывозит на продажу. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что за счет дохода от этого бизнеса она обеспечивает семью. Гулсара принимает кредит для купли несколько крупнорогатого скота. Она планирует увеличить поголовье скота и тем самым улучшить условия жизни семьи. Она надеется на Вашу помощь. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас.
texts.en:
Gulsara resides in the Yavan region with her husband and children. She is the mother of four children, two daughters and two sons. She is 46 years old. Her husband is a laborer. Every year, he goes to Russia to earn money for their living. Gulsara has been breeding cattle for ten years. She has a cattle shed, where she cares for her animals. She buys cattle, fattens them for several months, and then takes them for sale. Tending livestock is her main activity, because from it comes the income for supporting the family.

Gulsara is taking a loan to buy several cattle. She plans to increase her livestock count and at the same time to improve the living conditions of her family. She hopes for the help.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Guadalupe Flor

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 38 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y su menor hija en el distrito de Lagunas que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, así como también de productos de belleza, cuenta con 03 años de experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ropa y productos de belleza para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Guadalupe espera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 38 years old. She lives in her own home with her spouse and her youngest daughter in the district of Lagunas, which is located in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. She lives in a community that makes a living from commerce, agriculture, and stockbreeding. 

The makes a living from the sale of clothing for women, gentlemen, and children, as well as beauty products. She has 3 years of experience in this business with fixed customers who provide many good personal and work references for her. The use of this loan will be for the purchase of a larger quantity of clothing and beauty products to increase her business’s stock. With this, Guadalupe hopes to offer a greater variety of products to her clients, satisfying their tastes and preferences, which will generate a higher income for her and is going to permit her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of clothing and beauty products to increase her business's stock.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia, 22 years old, lives in Kolsa District. She is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers at her nearby secondary school by teaching life skills to students. She is single and the mother of one child. Sophia has been tailoring for a long time, which helps her to run her life. The community prospers from her work because she is a good clothing tailor. Sophia has requested a Kiva loan to purchase commodities such as vitenge and kanga (African traditional cloths) for her business.

loans.use: to purchase commodities for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase varieties of medicine

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a skilled 33-year-old seamstress, mother and volunteer teacher. Asha volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to students in her ward’s secondary school. Her lessons focus on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence. For her business, Asha sews women’s clothes and supplies school uniforms for local students. 

Asha is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy more sewing materials with which to expand her business. Profits from this will enable Asha’s business to develop further, by employing an assistant who can help her produce many more uniforms and other clothes. The interest on Asha’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to buy more sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a small dairy farmer who has been looking for opportunities to improve the productivity and efficiency of his farm. 

Before investing in his biodigester, he used to spend a significant amount of his revenues on LP gas and chemical fertilizers, while the household was relying on wood to cook. 

From now on, Juan will become his own renewable energy and fertilizer supplier by taking advantage of his cows' manure and transforming it into biogas and biofertilizer. 

Not only will he displace expensive and unsustainable external inputs, he will also protect the environment by treating the waste instead of piling it up outside his farm. 

His wife and children's health will improve as toxic smoke produced by burning wood is eliminated from the house. 

Juan plans to invest the savings he will make into a milking machine and tools to irrigate his field, resulting in higher productivity. 

In the medium term, Juan would also like to buy additional cows to reach higher milk production capacity.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
A senhora Angelica e casada mae de 2 filhos dos quais 1 esta a frequentar o ensino primário e o outro ainda e menor.
Com o valor do emprestimo pretende comprar  cimento, chapas de zinco, janelas para dar continuidade da sua obra.
A cliente tem como sonho concluir a sua obra para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e comprar mais bens para mesma.
Os principais desafios que infrenta são financeiros tem recorrido ao xitique com tudo pretende tomar mais credito para suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en: Angelica is married and the mother of two children, one of whom is in elementary school and the other who is not yet school-aged. With this loan she plans to buy cement, sheet metal, and windows to continue working on her house. Her dream is to finish her improvements so that she can provide a better home for her family and be able to afford more for them. Her main challenges are financial. Though she does have access to a xitique (traditional savings system), she plans to take out future loans to cover her needs.

loans.use: to buy cement, sheet metal, and windows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a cosmetics shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to launch a clothing business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is an innovative 24-year-old who lives with her parents and volunteers as a Camfed Leader Guide. In this capacity, she teaches life skills to students in her ward’s secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. 

Rehema also inspires students with her business skills, specializing in women’s clothes such as khanga and vitenge (African traditional cloths). Rehema is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to expand her business; she wants to purchase more clothes in bulk to sell in her shop. Rehema hopes to build herself a house with her profits. The interest on Rehema’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more clothing

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a hardworking 27-year-old who lives with her husband and two children. Tatu is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering to teach life skills to students for two and half hours per week. Through her lessons, Tatu encourages students to find their own strengths and to think about how to create a better world. 

Apart from volunteering, Tatu runs a stationery business and uses the profits to pay for her family's household expenses. She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy wholesale stock which she will sell for greater profit and so expand her business. Tatu also plans to reinvest these profits to increase her varieties of stationery. The interest on Tatu’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stock

loans.name: Socrates

texts.en:
Socrates is a married woman who hails from Talibon, Bohol. She is a mother of a seven-year-old daughter. She engages in raising and selling of hogs. Aside from that, she also toils on the land and does farming. She grows rice. She has been engaged in that kind of business for more than ten years now.

Socrates is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers and medicine. It will improve the yield of her farm, and she will start to raise more hogs to sell in the coming few months. She will be able to balance her finances and pay her obligations.

She hopes that she will be able to manage both her sources of income to become more productive and successful.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers and medicine.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 21-year-old who sews and volunteers as a teacher. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Asha volunteers her time weekly to teach life skills to students in a nearby secondary school. Through her lessons, she encourages students to find their own strengths and to think about how to create a better world.

Asha owns a spinning machine which helps her to earn some money for her basic needs. She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy many more sewing materials - including bed sheets - with which to expand her business. The interest on Asha’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to buy many more sewing materials

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a 37-year-old woman with two children ages 10 and 8. She lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has operated a tricycle transportation service  for 11 years. She is asking for a loan to buy fuel and pay for maintenance, which will be of great help to improve her business. Through her business, she can continue to provide her growing children with proper diets and to send them to school. Edna hopes to manage her current source of income to become more sustainable and able to provide her children with a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fuel and pay for maintenance

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
49-year-old Artemio runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic commodities ranging from seasonings, canned goods, beverages, soft drinks, condiments and toiletries.

He is a married man with three  children. Two of them are still attending school. Together with his family, he lives in Talibon, Bohol.

Arltemio has requested a loan to buy more goods like sugar, vinegar, soft drinks and other commodities. With these supplies, he will be able to cater to his customers and generate more income. He will be able to manage his finances and settle his obligations.

In the future, Artemio dreams of expanding his business to be profitable and sustainable so as to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more goods like sugar, vinegar, soft drinks and other commodities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business of selling men's and women's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to launch a grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a grocery store near her village.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 20 years old. She is not married and lives in the Handeni district. She is a Camfed learner who volunteers to teach life skills to students in her nearby secondary school. 

She has requested a Kiva loan to start a business of selling men's and women's clothes to improve her life. Mwajuma plans to use her profit to add clothes to her business and to help pay household expenses for her family.

loans.use: to start a business of selling men's and women's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business with women’s and men’s clothing.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is a dedicated 22-year-old, volunteering as a teacher and selling clothes for a living. She gives back to her community by volunteering in her nearby secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide. 

Through her lessons, Latifa encourages students to find their own strengths and to think about how to create a better world. Alongside this, Latifa runs a business of selling clothes from just outside her home.
 
Instead of displaying clothes on her wall, Latifa is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to build a proper store and a display frame for her clothes. This would be especially useful in the rainy season. 

The interest on Latifa’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to build a proper store and a display frame for her clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open her grocery store.

loans.name: Biesha

texts.en: Biesha is an inspiring 21-year-old running a market stall and volunteering as a teacher. In her role as a Camfed Learner Guide, she teaches life skills to students in her ward’s secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. Apart from volunteering, Biesha also inspires her students with her success at running her own market business. Her stall sells produce such as millet, onions, rice, tomatoes and beans, and Biesha uses her profit to cover household expenses. She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to expand her business by purchasing more stock. Biesha also intends to help orphan students in her community. The interest on Biesha’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to expand her food stall business by purchasing more stock

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a 24-year-old business woman, volunteer teacher, and mother. 

Volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide at her nearby secondary school, Prisca coaches students in self-awareness: her lessons focus on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence. 

Prisca is also a business woman, making and selling palm oil. She uses the profits she earns to support the basic needs of her family. She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy more products for making more palm oil, thereby expanding her business. 

The interest on Prisca’s loan will be repaid through her weekly 2 1/2 hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to buy more product for making palm oil.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. In addition to that, she also goes fishing. She sells fish to the locals in her place. She is a married woman with four grown children, from Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and purchase fishing net and nylon. These will definitely improve the yield of her farm and increase her ongoing catch. She could now provide nutritious foods which are very essential in her day to day activity. With these, she will be able to set aside some savings for future use.

With the loan she gets, Aurelia would like to expand both of her sources of living to become more productive and hopefully this will help her improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and purchase fishing net and nylon

loans.name: Proceso Jr

texts.en:
Proceso Jr is a 29-year-old married man with two young children from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in a hog raising business for 5 years. He also farms, growing and selling rice.

Proceso Jr is asking for a loan to  purchase pig feed and fertilizers for the farm. These tools are very helpful in augmenting his business as he could raise healthy pigs and gain more harvest from his farm. Proceso Jr could thereby provide healthy diets to the whole family. Proceso Jr would like to expand both of his businesses to make them productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 60 years old, married and has three children.

Aida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aida has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Aida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 58 years old, married and has five children.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old and married with five children. Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Helen has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 37 years old, married and has four children, who are all in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 41 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Rechel works very hard to provide for them.

Rechel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rechel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Rechel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 53 years old and married with two children. Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, spices and other groceries. 

In the future Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is 42 years old and has three children. Arlen is married, and two of her children are in school.

Arlen is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlen requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlen has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 34 years old and married with one child in school. Juvy works very hard to provide for the family.

Juvy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juvy has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Juvy would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Monica works very hard to provide for them.

Monica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Monica has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future, Monica would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina, 65 years old, is married and has seven children. Catalina works very hard to provide for them. For the past 6 years, Catalina has run a general store in the Philippines. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan through NWTF to further build her business. Catalina has requested PHP 15,000 to buy additional items such as eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell. In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, 50 years old, is married and has one child. Rebecca works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 3 years, Rebecca has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, diapers, noodles and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda, 42 years old, is married and has four children, two of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Hilda has operated an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials used for weaving. In the future, Hilda would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials used for weaving

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, 47 years old, is married and has two children. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them. For the past 16 years, Jocelyn has run a general store in the Philippines. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan through NWTF to further build her business. Jocelyn has requested PHP 15,000 to purchase items such as canned goods, eggs, biscuits, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items such as canned goods, eggs, biscuits, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 29-year-old tech entrepreneur, volunteer teacher, and mother. In her capacity as a Camfed Learner Guide, Eva teaches life skills to students in her ward’s secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. To support her family, Eva sells phones and provides phone services to her customers from her store. She started this business from difficult personal circumstances.

Eva is now requesting a Kiva loan in order more stock, including more phones handsets and phone covers. She plans to use her increased business profits to buy a plot of land, plant a crop, and export her harvest. The profits would also provide some capital for one of her dependent family members to start a business.

The interest on Eva’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s work with younger students.

loans.use: to order more stock, including more phones handsets and phone covers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tailoring supplies, and thereby improve her business.

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Melina is an innovative 19-year-old young woman. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life-skills to her students in the nearby secondary school. Her lessons focus on effective communication and building her students’ confidence. Melina also runs a grocery store business. 

She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to renovate her store frame, and plans to use the profits to increase her store’s stock and cover household expenses for her parents and herself. The interest on Melina’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to renovate the frame of her grocery store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a young and ambitious dairy farmer. She decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to take advantage of her cows' manure and make her activities on the farm more sustainable. By inputting her animals' waste in the biodigester, she will produce her own biogas, which will be connected to the boiler and cookstove in her house. It will also produce nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer for her field. As she becomes more self-sufficient in her energy and fertilizer supply, Elena will be able to displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizer, as well as woodfuel. This will result in significant health benefits, as no member of the household will inhale toxic smoke anymore. As the manure is treated in the biodigester, it will also protect Elena's direct environment instead of emitting greenhouse gases and contaminating underground water sources. 

With her savings, Elena plans to buy additional cows and a car, as well as continue saving to send her children to university.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 8 cubic metre Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is an entrepreneurial 20-year-old. As a means of giving back to her community, she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to students in her ward’s secondary school. Her lessons focus on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence. 

To make a living, Consolata runs a successful bicycle rental business. She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to expand her business with the purchase of more bicycles, which will allow her to earn more profits and cover her household expenses. 

The interest on Consolota’s loan will be repaid through her weekly 2 1/2 hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more bicycles to rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell men and women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business selling fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix his bulldozer so he can get back to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new chairs and tables for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Lotfi

texts.en:
Lotfi is a 23-year-old, single man from a village near Jenin city. He works sometimes as a construction worker, where he gets a low and unstable income. Lotfi also works with his family in their agricultural land. They plant seasonal crops and sell them in the local market.

Lotfi took a USD loan form Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to prepare the soil for the new season by plowing it and to buy fertilizer. By taking this loan, Lotfi will improve the land and increase the productivity. 

Lotfi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to prepare the soil for the new season by plowing it and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 31-year-old married man from Jericho. He is the father of one son and one daughter. Three years ago, he opened a small restaurant where he makes traditional meals. It is a good business and the demand is high, especially since the prices are very low.
Husam would like to improve his business so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new furniture for his restaurant.
Husam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new furniture for his restaurant.

loans.name: Daoud

texts.en:
Daoud is a 23-year-old single man from a village near Jerusalem. He recently started his own business, drawing banners, which needs artistic talent and experience. He delivers his products to clients, who place them on the street or on the storefront. It is a very good business and the raw materials Daoud needs are very cheap.

Daoud took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy a small car to deliver his products to clients. By taking this loan, Daoud will be able to improve his business and reduce his current transportation expenses.

loans.use: to buy a small car to deliver his products to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell at his stall

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is a 32-year-old married man from a village near Jenin. He works as an employee in the public sector, earning a low income. Four years ago, Akram opened a store to sell cosmetics and perfumes.

Akram took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new collection of makeup and perfumes to resell at his store. This will improve his business and his income.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of makeup and perfumes to resell at his store

loans.name: Josefa Benigna

texts.es:
Portoviejo conocida como la ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, Portoviejo se ha convertido en el más importante centro de actividad agrícola y comercial de la provincia de Manabí y base fundamental de su economía.
En este lugar vive la señora Josefa, tiene 64 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5  hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Ella vive en casa propia.
Doña Josefa para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, ella pasa en su negocio ya que es ahí donde le gusta estar ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene 38 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 6 años, le gusta los beneficios, el seguro salud, las charlas educativas, todo. Su sueño es tener la mejor tienda del sector.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds. It has become the most important center of agricultural and commercial activity of the province of Manabí and a fundamental pillar of its economy. 

In this place lives Josefa, who is 64 years old. She is a single mother with 5 children who are grown and independent. She lives in her own house. 

In order to help her family get ahead in life, Josefa operates a grocery store in her home. There she sells all types of products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, beans, vegetables and fruits. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m., and sometimes even later. She spends time at her business because that is where she likes to be, since in addition to earning a living, she enjoys the activity, and she finds out what is going on in the neighborhood. She has dedicated herself to this work for 38 years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to stock her store with more products. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, processed meats and other everyday staple products. She has been in her communal bank for 6 years, and she likes the benefits, the health insurance, the educational talks -- everything. Her dream is to have the best store in her area.

loans.use: to stock her store with rice, sugar, oil, detergents, processed meats and other everyday staple products.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 49 years old and married, with 12 children. With five children in school, Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items like shampoo and groceries, to sell in her general store.

Lourdes has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries, to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 57 years old and married with one child. Cornelia works very hard to provide for her family.

Cornelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like bread, canned goods, eggs, and groceries..

Cornelia has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Cornelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like bread, canned goods, eggs, and groceries.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 60-year-old widow with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Virginia has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Virginia has been in this business for one year. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Anamae

texts.en:
Anamae works hard to support her family. She is married and has an E-loading (mobile prepaid load) business in the Philippines.

Anamae requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more prepaid load to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Anamae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more mobile prepaid load to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 35-year-old married mother of four children, three in school.

Margie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margie has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business selling women's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying palms in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to launch a charcoal business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business of her own at a market store.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is an ambitious 20-year-old, living with her grandmother and two siblings. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in her nearby secondary school, teaching life-skills to students. Her lessons focus on effective communication and building her students’ confidence. To support her family’s basic needs, Sharifa deals at a market store. 

She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to purchase higher-quality commodities from urban areas which are further away, thereby expanding her business. Her profits would cover household expenses for her grandmother. 

The interest on Sharifa’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to purchase higher-quality commodities from urban areas to expand her business.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 23-year-old single man from Bethlehem. He lives with his parents and two brothers in a small, simple house. Five years ago, Ihab started his own work performing concerts. He has a musical mixer and now has very good experience.

Ihab took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new sound system for his business. By taking this loan, Ihab will be able to improve his business and attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy a new sound system for his business.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, 57, is a married woman who lives in a small community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has 5 married children. 

To make a living and support her family, Sim manages and operates a farming business on a small piece of farmland located near her house. She grows rice on her land, and she sells her agricultural products to local dealers. On average, she can generate earnings of 3 USD per day.

The current piece of farmland Sim owns is small and providing less. She wants to enlarge her area of farmland, but she cannot afford the cost. Therefore, Sim would like to take a Kiva loan through Hattha Kaksekar in order to buy a plot of land for growing rice. 

Sim hopes this additional farmland will help improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Patria Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al  banco comunal  “Virgen de Carmen de patria”, el poblado de Patria está ubicado dentro del distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco).
La socia Marleny continua dedicándose a la agricultura y crianza de animales, la socia agradece a los inversionistas  por el crédito otorgado y se compromete cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua criando  a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de madera, venta de cereales, ganadería, crianza de animales y agricultura.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “Virgen de Carmen de Patria” communal bank. The village of Patria is located within the district of Kosñipata, in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco.

The borrower, Marleny, continues to dedicate herself to agriculture and to raising animals. She is grateful to the lenders for the loan provided to her, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule. She is continuing to raise small animals in order to sell them to her customers who request them. This is the way she is helping her family get ahead in life. 

She is requesting the loan to buy natural fertilizer, among other supplies. 

The members as a group are grateful for the opportunity provided to them, and they are committed to making their various loan payments according to schedule. The other members dedicate themselves to selling wood, selling grains, raising livestock, raising small animals, and farming.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29-year-old married man from Khan Younis. A few  years ago, Mahmoud opened a grocery store in the city, selling basic grocery products to local clients.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop for installing an accounting system for his store. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to organize the store accounts and control them in a better way

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for installing an accounting system for his store

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia earns a living by means of fishing. She sells fish to the locals in her community. She is a 36-year-old married woman with five children, from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest is 18 and the youngest is 12. She has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years now.

Amelia has requested a loan to buy fishing net and pay for the repair of the motorboat. These tools are helpful in augmenting her livelihood. She could now improve her catch and sell more fish. Because of this, she will support the needs of her growing children. She could now also provide them with healthy food.

She is determined to expand her livelihood so all her children can finish school and also to improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy  fishing net and pay for the repair of the motorboat.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a hardworking woman. She sells fresh fish to the locals in her place. She is a 52-year-old married woman with one child. She is a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been selling fish for 11 years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is asking for a loan to buy a motorboat engine and additional capital to purchase more fish to sell. These will be of great help for Adelaida and her family. She will have a variety of fish to sell and augment her earnings. She will be able to settle her obligations and start to set aside some savings for emergency use.

In the future, Adelaida would like to manage her business to make it successful.

loans.use: to buy a motorboat engine and additional capital to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ranilo

texts.en:
Ranilo, 23, is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married with four young children. He sells fish to earn a living. He has been engaged in fishing for five years now.

He is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like a flashlight, battery and mask. These tools are very essential for the improvement of his fishing livelihood. It will help to increase his ongoing catch and increase his earnings. He could now provide his young children with nutritious diets and also better living conditions.

In the future, Ranilo dreams of expanding his fishing business to become more sustainable and being able to support the needs of his young children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a flashlight, battery and mask.

loans.name: Ma. Sonia

texts.en:
Ma. Sonia grows and sells rice.  She is a 59-year-old married mother of five children. Her youngest child is 18 years old. She lives in Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in farming for more than 20 years. She also raises and sells hogs to supplement her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pig feed to improve her farm in terms of growth and yield. She could then sell more rice and augment her earnings to support the needs of her children. 

 In the future, Ma. Sonia dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Juan Andres

texts.es:
Juan Andres tiene 66 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y comercio.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en este sector y tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito.
