El crédito será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Juan Andres espera ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que aumentará su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Andres, 66, and his wife live in Pucará, a district in the Cajamarca region of northern Perú.  The rural town where they live is peaceful and quiet.  Local people make their livings working farms and small businesses.

Juan Andres has operated a coffee-growing business for 10 years and has many good references, both personal and work-related.  He will use this loan to buy the fertilizers and organics that he needs to maintain his crop.  He expects the investment to improve the quality of his crop and, in turn, to bring him a better return when he sells it.  His goal is to improve both his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad que se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de panadería como empanadas, tortas, postres, entre otros, las ventas las realiza en el distrito de Pucará y caseríos aledaños. Cuenta con más de 10 años dedicándose a este rubro y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales de el. El destino del crédito será para la compra de utensilios de cocina así como también para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, con esto Gerardo espera implementar su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 54, lives in a small house in Pucará, a district in the Cajamarca region of northern Perú.  Farming and animal-rearing are common sources of income for the people here.

Gerardo operates a business making and selling empanadas, cakes and other prepared foods.  He draws his customers from Pucará and the surrounding area.  He has operated the business for 10 years and has many regular customers who can vouch for his good character.  He will use this loan to buy cooking utensils and other supplies for carrying on his business.  He expects the investment to help his business and, in turn, increase his income.  His goal is to improve both his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and other supplies for his food business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 31 years old, married and has five children who are currently all in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeleta

texts.en:
Jeleta is 39 years old and has seven children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Jeleta is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jeleta would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 46-year-old married woman with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, diapers, shampoo and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, diapers, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 33 years old and married with one child. Janice works very hard to provide for her family.

Janice runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 1,300 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

Janice has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Janice would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Valeria Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra es una joven de 25 años de edad, es madre soltera que tiene un hijo de 2 años, Alexandra vive con sus padres, ella se dedica  a la comercialización de cosméticos sea por catálogos  y  por pedidos, Alexandra necesita el credito para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos, la aspiración de Alexandra es mejorar su negocio y salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en: Alexandra is a young woman of 25. She is a single mother with a 2-year-old child. Alexandra lives with her parents, and she works selling cosmetics by catalog and by special order. Alexandra needs the loan to invest in buying cosmetics. Her aspiration is to improve her business and get ahead in life with her child.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes, 39 years old, is married and has one child in school. Lourdes is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Lourdes has been raising pigs for two years and has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios, 54 years old, is a widow with five children, one of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 2 years, Remedios has operated a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Maria Judy

texts.en:
Maria Judy is a 54-year-old married mother of 11 children, five in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Maria Judy has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Maria Judy requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy processed food to sell.

Maria Judy has been in this business for one year now. In the future, Maria Judy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy processed food to sell

loans.name: Rodylin

texts.en:
Rodylin is 36 years old, married, and has 5 children. 3 of her children are in school.

Rodylin is in the agriculture business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rodylin has been raising pigs for 8 years, and she has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF in order to sustain her business.

In the future, Rodylin would like to save enough money to both expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 36 years old and is married with 4 children. With 3 children in school, she works very hard to provide for all of her family. 

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 2 years now. 

Maribel has requested a 2,900 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy a solar lamp.

In the future, Maribel would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salma is a determined 22-year-old, who works and still gives two and half hours per week back to her community. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she teaches life skills to students in her ward’s secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and on personal confidence.

Palm oil business is common in Salma’s district, so competition can be fierce. She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to improve her business and purchase oil containers which will meet the needs of households in her community. The interest on Salma’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing containers

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, 41 years old, is married and has two children, ages 18 and 6. For almost 20 years, she has been engaged in farming, growing and selling rice. Her husband also has a small business which helps to meet their daily needs.

Marites is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and medicine. These will help improve her farm and gain a higher volume of harvest. Marites will be able to purchase nutritious diets and provide better shelters. In the future, Marites would like to expand her farming  business to make it productive and successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and medicine

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adán tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad de clima variado, que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al alquiler de su equipo de sonido para eventos tales como quinceañeros, matrimonios, fiestas infantiles y otras actividades, además trabaja como locutor en una radio de su distrito. Cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de sus equipos de sonido, de esta forma Adán espera poder brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela y así poder tener mejores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adán, 39, his wife, and their children live in Oyotún, a district in the Lambayeque region of northern Perú.  Farming, animal-rearing and small businesses are common sources of income for the people here.

Adán operates a business renting sound equipment for quinceañeros, weddings and other group events.  He also works as an announcer for a local radio station.  He has operated the equipment rental business for 8 years and has many good references.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to maintain his sound equipment.  The investment will allow him to provide a better service to his customers and, in turn, to increase his income.  His goal is to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain the equipment he needs for his party services business..

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa familiar de material rústico con sus 3 hijos en la parte rural del distrito de Sallique que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos como arroz, gaseosas, galletas, entre otros, cuenta con más de 10 años dedicándose al negocio y con clientela fija en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Gloria espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias, esto le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria, 40, is a single mother.  She and her 3 children live in a small house in a rural area of Sallique, a district in the Cajamarca region of northern Perú.  The area is peaceful and quiet.  Local people make their livings farming, raising animals and running small businesses.

Gloria has a corner store where she sells everyday products: rice, soft drinks, snacks, etc.  She has operated the business for 10 years and has many regular customers.  She will use this loan to stock her store with a wider range of products.  The investment will help her to meet the needs and wishes of her customers and, in turn, increase her income.  Her goal is to improve both her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her corner store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 60 years old, is married and has five children. She has been raising pigs in the Philippines for five years and also earns additional income from a general store. Elena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita, 36 years old, is married and has four children, three of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 12 years, Teresita has operated an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her business. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials used for weaving

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 55 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Susan is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hanisha

texts.en:
Hanisha is a determined 19 year old, volunteering as a teacher at the local secondary school. In her capacity as a Camfed Learner Guide, she teaches life-skills to students including lessons on effective communication, personal confidence and improving performance.
Hanisha is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to start a clothes-selling business. She wants to sell clothes of all sizes, in order to generate profit for both re-investment into bulk buying, and for covering household expenses. The interest on Hanisha’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable to Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to start a clothes-selling business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to run her petrol-selling business near her home

loans.name: G.s. Triunfadores Group

texts.es:
El G.S. Triunfadores esta conformados por tres integrantes, madres  y padres responsables, que se conocen entre sí y decidieron unirse para el beneficio de un crédito para invertir en sus  actividades económicas, ya que son el sustentos de sus familias.  Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, en la actualidad luchan para brindarles a sus hijos las oportunidades que ellos no tuvieron, y de dicha formar cumplir con sus metas y objetivos propuestos 
Gracias a su perseverancia  la coordinadora es Dilena y tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y  venta de pan, de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos como son: picos, cachos, tortas dulces, rosquillas, polvorones, empanadas,  El objetivo del crédito es surtir su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ya que en este momento ha crecido en clientela ya que entrega por encargos a la pulperías de la localidad. Y para que en  un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  G.S  Triunfadores agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The three members of the Triunfadores community bank are responsible men and women, parents and long-time friends who came together to start this group in the hope that it would support their businesses and help them to better provide for their families.  The members are known to be hard-working and responsible, hopeful of pulling themselves up.  All had to go to work before they could finish school and each hopes now to be able to give their children the opportunity to study and learn that they themselves never had.  

The group's leader, Dilena, is a street vendor.  She makes and sells baked goods--bread, empanadas, donuts, etc.--and normally works eight hours a day.  She will use the loan to buy the supplies she needs to carry on her business and meet the growing demand for her products from local stores.  The investment will eventually increase her income, she says.  The members of the Triunfadores community bank want Kiva lenders to know that they are grateful for the help that you provide to people with few resources of their own.  Nicaragua is a poor country and your help provides borrowers here with opportunities to make decent livings.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: Progreso 2 Group

texts.es:
En la región donde se formó el grupo Progreso 2, la producción de caña y azúcar son las máximas fuentes de trabajo. Los integrantes eligieron el nombre que los identifica porque su intención es progresar y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Por lo anterior decidieron solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund México para invertir en sus actividades:

Amalia -Club Nutricional
Teresita -Abarrotes
Zenaida -Ropa
Benedita -Antojitos
Luz - Antojitos Y Calzado
Rafaela -Manteles, Servilletas
Anayhely -Tamales
María -Tamales Y Zapatos

Doña Amalia es una mujer emprendedora quien ha visto en una empresa de suplementos y productos naturistas una gran oportunidad pues desde hace ya 5 años le brindaron la opción de incorporarse como socia. De esta manera, abrió un pequeño club de nutrición en la comunidad donde día con día trabaja brindando la mejor atención a sus clientes a quienes siempre recibe con una sonrisa. “Mi vida cambió desde que inició la actividad, pues la empresa proveedora de productos me ha reconocido mi desarrollo con varios premios por ser una de las mejores vendedoras de la región". Algunos de los reconocimientos que ha recibido Amalia son menciones, cenas y viajes a la playa, además de que son una manera de seguirla motivando a continuar con su gran esfuerzo.

Doña Amalia está muy contenta pues alcanzó la meta de ventas que se propuso y logró avanzar una categoría más en el esquema de ventas de la empresa proveedora. Comenta que los préstamos de VisionFund México le ayudaron a llegar a su meta pues tuvo el capital para comprar todos los productos necesarios para revender. Actualmente, Amalia tiene cinco clubes activos y espera abrir uno más. 

Ahora necesita invertir nuevamente en té, aloe, proteínas, polvo para malteada, galletas, yogurt, barras de proteína por mencionar algunos productos para tener la mercancía suficiente en sus negocios. Si bien Amalia ha enfrentado momentos difíciles en su vida hoy en día los ha superado y su actividad le ha permitido disfrutar de gratos momentos y de mantener un ingreso propio.

*Las integrantes del grupo eligieron el lugar para la fotografía debido a la fe que profesan, Doña Amalia es quien viste blusa blanca de manga corta y pantalón de vestir color negro.
texts.en:
In the region where the group "Progreso 2" was formed, cane and sugar production are the leading sources of jobs. The members chose this name to identify their group because their aim is to make progress and offer a better quality of life to their families. For these reasons, they decided to request a loan from VisionFund México to invest in their businesses: 

Amalia - Nutrition club
Teresita - Groceries
Zenaida - Clothing
Benedita - Snacks
Luz - Snacks and footwear
Rafaela - Tablecloths, napkins
Anayhely -Tamales
María - Tamales and shoes

Amalia is an enterprising woman who found a great opportunity in a business of natural products and supplements. Five years ago, she was offered the opportunity to become a member. She opened a small nutrition club in the community, where she works day after day providing the best service to her customers, whom she always receives with a smile. "My life has changed since I started this work, since the company which provides the products has recognized my development with various prizes for being one of the best sellers in the region." Some of the recognition Amalia has received includes special mentions, dinners and beach trips. This is also a way of keeping her motivated to continue with her great effort. 

Amalia is very happy because she has achieved the sales goal she set for herself, and she was able to advance one more category in the sales organization of the provider company. She comments that the loans from VisionFund México helped her achieve her goal, since she had the capital to buy all of the necessary products to resell. Currently, Amalia has five active clubs and hopes to open one more. 

Now she needs to invest once again in tea, aloe, proteíns, malt powder, biscuits, yogurt, and protein bars, to mention some of the products, so that she can have sufficient merchandise for her business. Although Amalia has faced difficult moments in her life, today she has overcome them, and her work has allowed her to enjoy happy moments and earn a steady income of her own.

*The group members chose the location for the photo due to the faith they profess. Amalia is the one wearing a white short-sleeved blouse and black pants.

loans.use: to buy tea, aloe, proteíns, malt powder, biscuits, yogurt, protein bars and other products for her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Myrna has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

Myrna has been in her business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Delfino

texts.en:
Delfino decided to purchase a biodigester in order to improve his productivity, protect the environment and save the money he used to spend on expensive LP gas, chemical fertilizers and wood. He used to pile his cows', sheep's and hogs' manure outside the farm, where it was contaminating underground water sources, emitting greenhouse gases and attracting flies. With his biodigester, he will treat it and transform it into productive resources: biogas and biofertilizer. 

The biogas will allow the household to cook and heat water using renewable energy, while the organic and nutrient-rich fertilizer will nourish the soils of Delfino's field in a sustainable way, improving its yield in the long term. Delfino plans to use his savings to expand his current milk production by acquiring more cows and investing in improving the infrastructure of his fossil fuel-free farm.

This loan represents 8% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 14 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.en:
José Luis owns several cows, hogs and sheep. He dedicates himself to raising them and selling his cows' milk, while he also cultivates forage to produce a part of their food. He used to spend an important portion of his revenues on LP gas and chemical fertilizers, and decided to purchase a biodigester in order to get rid of these unproductive expenses. 

At the same time, the biodigester will allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life and protect the environment. Indeed, as José Luis inputs his animals' manure in the system, it will no longer contaminate underground water sources, attract flies or emit greenhouse gases. His wife will cook and heat water with biogas, as the boiler and cookstove will be directly connected to the biodigester. Further, the biodigester produces nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer with important properties that nourish soils and increase crops' yield in a sustainable manner. As he generates savings, he plans to invest in improving the backyard for his cows, and improve the quality of their food.

This loan represents 8% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 14 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics, fishing products and aloe vera products.

loans.name: Twiyegeranye Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe  Twiyegeranye et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 30 ans et est marié à Roselyne, une cultivatrice. 
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants membre de sa famille élargie qui étudient. 

Il est coiffeur dans son salon   depuis  3 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  d’autres  matériels (tondeuses) pour servir mieux ses clients et afin de gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait avoir un autre salon de coiffure, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is part of the group Twiyegeranye and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 30 years old and is married to Roselyne, who is a farmer. He has two children under his custody, who are extended family members, and in school.

He has been a barber in his salon for three years.  

He is on his second loan from Turame.  With the Kiva loan that he receives, he will grow his savings and buy other materials (clippers) in order to better serve his customers and to earn more.

In the next years, he would like to open another barber shop and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his savings and buy other materials (clippers) in order to better serve his customers and earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is from Coron Palawan and has been an active member of CCT for years now. He has been able to acquire several loans to make a good profit from his general store business. He and his wife are helping each other provide for their daily needs. He was inspired to improve their lives because he wants to give his children the best for their future. He works hard each day and is getting closer to reaching his goals.

Jerry believes that business is his stepping stone for making his dreams come true. He knows how important it is for his neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, an egg,  toothpaste or even an ice tube. He gets his products from a wholesaler at a lower price then sells the goods per piece at a profit.

He desires to expand his store so he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He is positive that he will become a successful businessman in the future. He looks forward to seeing his children finish their studies through all his hard work and perseverance.

Jerry meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to improve his profit.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 34 years old and married with five children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Norma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.  Norma has been farming rice for 20 years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Roberto Vinicio

texts.es: Vinicio es un joven de 26 años de edad,  tiene una hija de 4 años, Vinicio  vive con sus padres y con sus hermanos, Vinicio se dedica 6 años a la crianza de chanchos, también trabaja al jornal, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar chanchos para mejorar su negocio y su aspiración es seguir trabajando para darle a su hija lo necesario.
texts.en:
Vinicio is a young 26-year-old man. He has a 4-year-old daughter, and Vinicio lives with his parents and his siblings.

Vinicio has made a living raising pigs for 6 years. He is also a day laborer. 

With the money from this loan, he is going to buy pigs to improve his business. His aspiration is to continue working in order to give his daughter all that is necessary.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 65 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.   

Yolanda has a copra (coconut meat) retail business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more copra.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more copra (coconut meat).

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 36 years old and married with three children who are currently in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Janice is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Janice has been raising pigs for four years and earns additional income from a personal products retail business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg is 46 years old and lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a gardener at an urban development company since 2012. Her son works as sentry at a train station. She has one daughter who got married and lives on her own. The house she and her son live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some renovation. So, she is requesting a loan of  $1,000 (USD) to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en:
Mrs. Solongo, 30 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been rendering taxi services to local people for one year. Her husband works as a welder at building company. Their children go to secondary school. 

The house her family lives in has been deteriorated over the years and is vulnerable to cold winter. So, she is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to install an electric heater into her house. By doing this her family will be able to live in a constant warm place, burn less coal for heating, and release fewer pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to install an electric heater into her house to burn less coal.

loans.name: Bulgantamir

texts.en:
Mr. Bulgantamir, 27 years old, lives with his his parents and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2012. 

Due to long time usage, his truck has been damaged. So, he is requesting a loan of 2,500 USD to buy spare parts in order to repair his damaged truck. 

After the repairs, he will continue his transportation business and provide income to his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his damaged truck.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Mai 2011,est constitué de 18 membres qui habitent tous dans le même village.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Aissatou, se trouvant debout a droite de la photo et levant, est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle est mariée et mére de huit enfants dont cinq garçons et trois filles. Elle même le commerce comme activité principale.

Avec son crédit, elle compte acheter 50kg de fonio à 40000f, 60l de karité à 60000f ,30 sacs de pain de singe à 90000f dont 3000f le sac et 10000f pour les frais de transport.

Ces bénéfices serviront à payer les frais de scolarité de ces enfants et aux dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
This group was created in May of 2011, and it consists of 18 members who all live in the same village. Their main activity is commerce.

The group’s featured borrower is Aissatou, standing on the right and raising her hand. Aissatou is the married mother of 8 children, 5 boys and 3 girls. 
She practices a commercial activity. 

She will use her loan to buy 50 kg of fonio for 40,000f, 60 liters of shea butter for 60,000f, 30 sacks of baobab fruit for 90,000f (priced at 3,000f each), and she will pay 10,000f for transportation. 

Aissatou will use her profits to pay her children’s tuition fees and to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of fonio for 40,000f, 60 liters of shea butter for 60,000f, 30 sacks of baobab fruit for 90,000f (priced at 3,000f each), and to pay 10,000f for transportation.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADORAS, la socia  sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de frutas, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva años con su negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar platanos, manzanas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank MADRES TRABAJADORAS [Hardworking Mothers], and continues to make a living through her business selling fruit. 

She is thankful for the approved loan, and promises to fulfill her loan payments. This member is responsible and diligent, and she has been in this business for years, which is how she provides for her family.

This member is requesting a loan to buy bananas and apples, among other fruit.

loans.use: to buy bananas and apples, among other fruit.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona es una mujer de 45 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 18 años y una hija mujer de 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de repuestos para automóvil.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa, amable, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Villa Dolores’ una de las primeras zonas urbanizadas de la ciudad, donde el desarrollo vertiginoso, pero desorganizado de su población, aglomeró a una gran cantidad de comerciantes, donde se observa desde vendedores en puestos fijos y ambulantes, inclusive niños y niñas trabajando en el mercado junto a sus padres y algunos de manera independiente, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0 y 14 grados centígrados.
Simona es de piel morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, complexión física robusta, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, pollera y sombrero) su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza al lado de sus hijos; su hijo atiende un taller mecánico en su domicilio y su hija estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su actividad principal es la venta de repuestos para automóvil, tales como;  Alternadores y arranque, amortiguadores, baterías y accesorios, cables, correas y mangueras, filtros, limpia parabrisas, partes del encendido, etc. “mi hijo maneja un taller mecánico motivo por el cual emprendí mi negocio de venta de repuestos, los clientes que tengo vienen del taller y otros son particulares…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda grande de repuestos, Ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de repuestos para automóvil para incrementar su oferta y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos en 2 años y medio que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Simona solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de repuestos para automóvil para incrementar su stock y generar mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Simona is a 45-year-old woman. She is single, and she has an 18-year-old son and a 13-year-old daughter. Her business is selling spare parts for automobiles. 

She is a good mother, optimistic, with a good attitude, committed to her work, generous, likable, independent, responsible and hard-working. She operates her business in the ‘Villa Dolores’ zone, one of the city's first urbanized areas, where very rapid but disorganized population growth brought together a great number of merchants. These include vendors with fixed locations and mobile vendors, including boys and girls who work at the market together with their parents, and some who work independently. The area has a cold, dry climate with a temperature which varies during the day between 0 and 14 degrees Centigrade. 

Simona has brown skin and long black hair, which she wears braided. She has a sturdy build and is short in stature, and she wears traditional clothing (shawl, skirt and hat). Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks at home. She also speaks Spanish because of the broader culture and the work that she does. She lives with her children at her side: her son operates a mechanic's workshop in their home, and her daughter is in school. They live in a house of their own, constructed of brick with a roof made of metal sheeting. The house has water, electricity, gas and sewer services. Her main work is selling spare parts for cars, such as alternators, starters, shock absorbers, batteries, accessories, cables, belts, filters, windshield wipers, spark plugs, etc. "My son operates a mechanic's shop, which was a motive for me to start my spare parts business. I have customers who come from the workshop, and others come on their own," she comments. Her dream is to have a large spare parts store. She would like to buy a variety of car parts to increase her offerings and meet her customers' needs. This is the first sequence of loans in the two-and-a-half years she has been carrying out this activity. For these reasons, Simona is requesting a loan to buy a variety of spare parts for cars, to expand her stock and generate increased sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spare parts for cars, to expand her stock and generate increased sales.

loans.name: Lilet

texts.en: Lilet is a 46-year-old mother of five children who owns and manages their family carenderia (eatery) business. She has  supported her husband in this business for the past year and needs to expand to increase income. GDMPC credit and savings institution granted her PHP 8,000 loan request. She will purchase soft drinks, meat, vegetables and seasonings for her new menu. She's now happy cooking and selling food for her carenderia. She plans to save for her children's education and for future needs.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, meat, vegetables and seasonings for her carenderia (eatery).

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 48 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Susana has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rachel works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Rachel is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Cresell

texts.en:
Cresell is 37 years old and married woman with seven children, five in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Cresell has a bag-making business in the Philippines. Cresell requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her bag-making business.

Cresell has been in this business for three years. In the future, Cresell would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her bag-making business.

loans.name: Mary Beth

texts.en:
Mary Beth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more household goods to sell like soap, milk, coffee, eggs, and canned goods for her general store business.

Mary Beth has been in this business for six years. Mary Beth earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her general store business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell like soap, milk, coffee, eggs and canned goods

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en:
Abegail is a 29-year-old married mother of two children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Abegail has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Abegail requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Abegail has been in this business for 18 years now. In the future, Abegail would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 55 years old and married with seven children.  She works hard to provide for her family.

 She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell.  Merlinda has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for 15 years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has six children who are in school.

Edita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Edita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annaliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net. She has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old now.

Edna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 27 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of recycled materials to sell.

Vanessa has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell recycled materials for two years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia is 58 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Evelia works very hard to provide for them.

Evelia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, shampoo, groceries, etc.  Evelia has been in this business for 30 years now. 

In the future, Evelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support her family. Angelita is married, and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Angelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell in her business.  Angelita has been in this business for four years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell in her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 34 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Aida has borrowed and paid twenty loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising pigs and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Babyncia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Babyncia works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns  income from food vending. 

Babyncia, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 12000 to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish

loans.name: Otgonbat

texts.en: Mr. Otgonbat is requesting a loan of 1,300 USD to install an electric heater into his house. Because his house is not well insulated, he burns too much coal for warming up. The borrower renders a taxi service to local people for a living and he is currently living alone in his house. With the loan, he will install an electric heater and reduce coal usage, contributing to the effort against air pollution.

loans.use: to install an electric heater into his house.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADORAS, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de plátanos y ocas al horno, la socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo a  todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de plátanos entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the MADRES TRABAJADORAS (Working Mothers) community bank. She keeps working selling bananas and roast geese. 

This member is glad for the loan, and she is committed to make her payments. She keeps selling to all of her customers. She is a responsible and diligent person. This is how she has managed to support her family.

This member requested the loan to buy bananas among other things.

loans.use: to buy bananas among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy condiments to prepare the dishes she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Batchimeg, 27 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a kindergarten teacher since 2012. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their children attend kindergarten. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to buy spare parts in order to repair her husband's car. Due to over usage, her husband's car has been damaged.  Since the main family income comes from the taxi service, it has become necessary to repair the car as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair her husband's car.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is thankful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like canned goods, coffee, soda and rice noodles, and also to buy umbrellas, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Lilia dreams of having a bigger general store, and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan. She is 57 years old and has eight children. She, together with her husband, breeds and raises pigs to provide income for their everyday needs and expenditures.

She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 10,000 in sales every month.  Nelly is taking out PHP 10,000 loan assistance to buy additional hogs and feed. 

She will be utilizing the loan to buy products and other materials, which are necessary to increase her inventory. In the future, Nelly hopes to grow her business and so her earnings. She dreams that her children will complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs, and also to buy new small ones.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Hermelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Hermelinda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as slippers, etc. for her ready-to-wear business.

Hermelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as slippers, etc.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 34 years old and married with seven children.

Jenalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, condiments, eggs, groceries, etc.

Jenalyn has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Jenalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, condiments, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, a 35-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for them. For 17 years now she has operated a general store in the Philippines.

Juliet has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Charito has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to have money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Lorna is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 42 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Brenda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Brenda has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling medicines.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly, 36, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a silversmith. Ly started a shop selling flowers eight years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of flowers to sell during traditional holidays. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy flowers to sell.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADORAS, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua  vendiendo  galletas, dulces, gaseosas y chocolates, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar galletas, chocolates entre otros.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the MADRES TRABAJADORAS (Working Mothers) community bank. She still sells candy.

She is thankful to those who take part in this dream through this loan. She is committed to make the payments within the due date.

This group member keeps selling cookies, sweets, sodas, and chocolates. She is a responsible and diligent person, and this is how she supports her family.

This member is requesting the loan to buy cookies and chocolate among other things.

loans.use: to buy cookies and chocolate among other things.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 23 years old and a single woman.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Grace has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 23 years old and has two children.  Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Nenita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Nenita has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dellie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Dellie works hard to support her family.

She has a business, selling woven bamboo in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling vegetables and farming vegetables. Dellie is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more bamboo to weave for her bamboo weaving business.

Dellie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo for weaving.

loans.name: Ronila

texts.en:
Ronila is 46 years old and married.

Ronila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell at her store, such as beverages, canned goods, condiments, groceries, etc.

Ronila has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns income from a food vending business.

Ronila aspires to build and expand her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell at her store, such as beverages, canned goods, condiments and groceries.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, born in 1984, is an ethnic Tay woman. She currently lives with her husband and her three children (one daughter and two sons) in Mai Son district, Son La province.	

Her family’s main income is from her husband’s monthly salary, which is not considerable, but just enough to cover the family’s living expenses. She wants to invest in raising chickens and ducks to get additional income, but she doesn’t have enough money. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy breeding chickens and ducks and to buy food for them
. 
She really hopes that the loan will help her family invest in breeding with high productivity, and that the sales of chickens and ducks will bring her family  a considerable benefit. She will also work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy breeding chickens and ducks and to buy food for them.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 28-year-old woman with a partner and one child. She runs a business designing clothes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Susana has requested a loan to buy paint, design board, sponge, material, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her business income. 

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, design board, sponge, material, etc..

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Enkhjargal is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2009. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home, taking care of household chores. Using his previous loan, he has done business of coal sales and improved his living standards. 

Now he is requesting a loan of 625 USD to buy spare parts in order to repair his car. His car is damaged due to over usage. As he is the sole provider of income to his family, it is essential to repair his car as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his damaged car.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea, a 39-year-old married mother of three, runs a small business selling banana chips in her community. She has been doing this for more than four years. 

A member of SPBD since 2010, Lea has requested a loan to buy a fry pan, cooking oil, bananas, salts, etc. With her earnings, she will expand her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cooking oil, salts, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Celinia

texts.en:
Celinia is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase supplies and materials for the maintenance of their repair machines. Her earnings helped send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy supplies like wirings, putty paint, and other materials needed for the repair, check-ups, and beautification of all types of cars and vehicles referred to them. Her income from her shop is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Celinia dreams of expanding her repair shop to increase her business. She wants the best college education for her children. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed in her auto repair shop and for the maintenance of the machines.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADORAS, la socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de transporte, el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que le socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.
texts.en:
This man belongs to the “Madres Trabajadoras” (Hard-Working Mothers) communal bank. He continues working in his transportation business. He is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the repayments. He is a very responsible and diligent, since his business is how he takes his family forward.

He requests the loan to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Maria is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing nets for her fishing business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her previous two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Harchie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Harchie works hard to support her family.

She has a motorycle passenger transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. 

Harchie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Harchie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 42 years old and married with four children.

Ruth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell at her store, such as beverages, eggs, canned goods, coffee, groceries, etc.

Ruth has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years, and also earns income from a food vending business.

Ruth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell at her store, such as beverages, eggs, canned goods, coffee and groceries.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Adelaida works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing and a general store. Adelaida is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Adelaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and has six children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell at her store, such as beverages, canned goods, condiments, groceries, etc.

Susan has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years, and also earns income from buying and selling firewood.

Susan aspires to build and expand her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell at her store, such as beverages, canned goods, condiments and groceries.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a food vending business. Vilma is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance for her bicycle.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her bicycle.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Bich is requesting a loan to buy a range of new soft drink products to restock her shop. These purchases will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Bich's previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in expanding the shop and increasing her sales, which will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of different clothing to sell to her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and increase her sales. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increasing her income, and that it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh is requesting a loan to buy hair tools and shampoos to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and her income, as well as improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair tools and shampoos to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es una mujer de 44 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, vive y depende de sus habilidades culinarias, con las cuales ha tenido trabajos en diferentes locales, y puestos de comida rápida.
Por cuestiones de títulos estudiantiles Marisol se quedó sin empleo y al no tener si quiera una persona que le colabore con gastos mientras encuentra trabajo, se le vuelve en una necesidad latente por eso opto por la opción de solicitar un préstamo e iniciar de manera formal su propio punto de venta de alimentos, justo afuera de su hogar.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de: 
•	2 planchas para asar los alimentos
•	Implementos de cocina 
•	Fritador
•	Pipeta de gas
•	Una carpa 
•	Silletería
•	Surtido de alimentos
Estos son los insumos que comprara con el préstamo y su propósito será hacer del negocio un éxito, tener sostenibilidad en el tiempo y generar empleo
texts.en:
Marisol is a 44-year-old woman. She is single and does not have children. She depends on her culinary skills, with which she has had jobs in differences places and fast food stands.

Because she doesn’t have any school degrees, Marisol remained without a job, and having no one who will cover her expenses while she looks for work, she turned to an unrealized need. Therefore, she chose to request a loan and formally start her own snacks stand. She requests a loan to buy: 
• 2 metal sheets to cook the food 
• Cooking tools 
• A fryer 
• A gas pipette 
• A carp 
• Seating
• A supply of food

These are the supplies that she will buy with the loan. Her goal will be to have her business be a success, be sustainable over time, and generate jobs.

loans.use: to buy tools, including a fryer, pipettes, and chairs among other things.

loans.name: Albertus

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of the new Ruma agents, Albertus. Albertus lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and they have been blessed with three children. Albertus’ wife is a full time housewife and mother. Albertus owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products, small snacks and provides mobile payment services. He knows Ruma from a sales executive who came to his own stall and explained about Ruma’s core and purpose. 

He was interested in joining Ruma because he wants to learn how to improve his business, as well as contribute to his community. As the business starts, Albertus needs to obtain a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services for his community. 

Having known about the importance of Albertus being able to secure a loan, your loan will be very useful in helping him to improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Albertus is the one who is standing in front of his own small stall. He is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1976, and she lives in a remote area. She was raised in a family of farmers. Her parents were workers at a collective farm in the period of the USSR. Muborak was taught how to work on the land from her childhood. Her parents did not have money to educate their children. 

When she became older, her parents gave her out to marriage. She has four children now. When she had her fourth child, her husband and she thought about how to keep a family for the future. They experienced some difficulties in this period. Her husband had to fly to Russia to earn money. Muborak and her husband wanted to keep their family safe and educate their children well. For the first time her husband could not send money. Muborak tried to keep a family alone. She tried to spend money only for everyday food. They even did not buy clothes. 

When the collective farm spread land out for farmers, Muborak also asked for help to have land for planting seeds and earning some income. The collective farm gave her land for planting. After about two years, she is planting cotton, sunflowers and Lucerne. Her children are helping her to do the business. She had honored cattle, but she had a debt that needed to be paid, so she sold her cattle. The profits that she gets from planting seeds cover all the expenditures of her family. 

This year, the harvest is not good, so she needs to improve her land. Due to a crisis, her husband cannot send money; he promised to send it next month. But Muborak needs to buy fertilizer and seeds now. She is requesting financial support from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Yolanda is 53 years old and has two children who are in school.

Yolanda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Yolanda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Zita works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle passenger transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Zita is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle transport business.

Zita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 25 years old and married with five children.  With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cherry has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soap, sugar and other groceries.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 26 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Cris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Mary Cris has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Miralyn

texts.en:
Miralyn is 40 years old and has 11 children. She is married and six of her children are in school.
