Miralyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Miralyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Miralyn has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Miralyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 40 years old and is married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Marilou has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 53 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. Она на протяжении уже 33 лет успешно занимается полеводством и животноводством. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Бактыгул есть 5 коров. На участке мерою 2,0 Га она выращивает кукурузу и табак для реализации. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Baktygul is 53 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has been successfully involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for 33 years already.  Today, she has five cows on her farm, and she also grows corn and tobacco for resale on two hectares of land.  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase three cows and increase her cattle headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to develop her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase three cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Robby

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of Ruma's agents, Robby. He joined Ruma five months ago. He lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife. 

Robby owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services. He learned of Ruma from a sales executive who came to his stall and explained Ruma’s core and purpose. He feels happy to join Ruma because he learns a lot about how to improve his business. He also thinks that Ruma has the best service and the sales executive is really helpful and informative. 

As the business grows, Robby needs a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Your loan will be very useful in helping Robby improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Robby is the one who is sitting. He is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer casada, es madre de dos hijos de 12 y 18 años de edad, como toda madre quiere lo mejor para ellos y lucha por que tenga mejores condiciones de vida de las que ella pudo tener, una razón muy validad para emprender un nuevo camino en su vida el cual será como comerciante independiente, muy contrario a sus actividades diarias que básicamente son las de ser ama de casa.
El deseo de que su hijo vaya  la universidad y se forme para ser el primer universitario de su familia le llena de emoción, de ganas de trabajo y de hambre de progreso, es por esto que solicita formalmente una ayuda crediticia para iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios para dama.
Con el dinero comprara conjuntos deportivos, blusas, blue jeans, aretes, collares, pulseras, relojes, entre otros
texts.en:
Luz is a married woman, and she is the mother of two children, who are 12 and 18 years old. Like all mothers, she wants the best for her children, and she fights so that they have the best conditions in life that she can give them. This is a very good reason for her to begin a new path in her life, which will be as an independent businesswoman. This will be very different from her daily activities, which are basically those of a housewife.

Her dream is that her son goes to university. This would make him the first university student in her family, which fills her with emotion. She has the desire to work and the hunger to go forward. Because of this, she formally requests a loan to start her business selling clothes and accessories for women. With the money, she will buy sports outfits, blouses, blue jeans, earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and watches, among other things.

loans.use: to buy sports outfits, blouses, blue jeans, earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and watches, among other things.

loans.name: Sababounyuman Group

texts.fr:
Rokia est une femme  malienne âgée de 38 ans, elle est restauratrice. Elle est  séparée de son conjoint, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants dont deux (02) vont à l’école, ils sont âgés de 13 à 22 ans. Les enfants sont  à sa charge. Elle a un niveau d’étude très bas car elle a abandonnée les études en classe de 5ème  Année fondamentale. Rokia est la femme au milieu et qui tient une louche et une tasse en main sur la photo.
Rokia vend du riz, de viande, du tôt, du poisson … dans son restaurant. Elle fait recourt au prêt du RMCR pour acheter plus de  sacs de  riz et de viande pour pouvoir servir plus de clients.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de la localité en riz, mil ; maïs et condiments pour son restaurant. Elle a comme bénéfice prévisionnel journalier 3 500F CFA soit 90 000F CFA par mois en moyenne.
Rokia est beaucoup motivée pour cette activité de restauration car c’est une activité qui la permet d’être indépendante en matière de prise en charges de la nourriture, d’habillements,  de soins médicaux  et frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Rokia is a 38-year-old Malian woman. She has a restaurant. She is separated from her spouse, and is the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom go to school. They are between 13 and 23 years old. The children are all in her care. She has very little education because she left school in 5th year of elementary school. Rokia is the woman in the center who has a bowl in her hand in the photo.
Rokia sells rice, meat, fish and other dishes in her restaurant. She came to RMCR for a loan to purchase more sacks of rice and meat in order to serve more clients.
She makes her purchases at the local markets in her area for rice, millet and condiments for her restaurant. She makes about 3500 Francs ($7) in profit per day, or about 90,000  Francs ($180) per months in profit on average. 
Rokia is very motivated by her restaurant business because it's an activity that allows her to be independent in providing for her children's food, clothing, medical care and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and cereal for her restaurant

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of the new Ruma agents, Ahmad. He lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife. 

Ahmad owns a stall, where he sells mobile phone accessories and provides mobile payment services. He knows Ruma from a sales executive who came to his own stall and explained Ruma’s core and purpose. He was interested in joining Ruma because he wanted to learn about how to improve his business, as well as contribute to his community. 

As the business starts, Ahmad needs to obtain a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Having known about the importance of the loan, it will be very useful in helping Ahmad improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Ahmad is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфуза верная жена и мать двоих замечательных детей. Сыну 23 года, дочке 13 лет. Дилфуза с мужем всегда помогали друг другу и были бок о бок рядом в трудные моменты в жизни, в том числе и сейчас. Ее мужу сейчас нужна помощь, он не нашел работу и решил купить машинку, чтобы предоставлять услуги такси. МДО "Хумо" большое внимание уделяем женщинам клиентам и женщинам удобнее получать кредит. По этой причине Дилфуза сама обратилась за кредитом, чтобы помочь мужу купить машину. Сама Дилфуза занимается шитьем одежды на дому. Дилфуза будет Вам очень благодарна, если Вы поможете ее семье в трудную минуту.
texts.en: Dilfuza is a devoted wife and the mother of two wonderful children.  Her son is 23 years old, her daughter is 13.  Dilfuza and her husband have always helped each other and, in the past, they have gone through the most difficult times of their lives side by side.  This is still the case today.  Dilfuza's husband currently needs help.  He hasn't been able to find work and has decided to buy a car in order to provide taxi services.  Kiva's partner, MDO Humo, pays a particular attention to its female customers, and women enjoy receiving loans from them.  For this reason, Dilfuza herself has decided to apply for a loan, so that she can help her husband to buy a car.  Dilfuza works as a seamstress from home.  She thanks you in advance for supporting her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a car for her husband, so that he can start working as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Manaia

texts.en:
Manaia is a 22-year-old, single woman, with no children. She runs a business designing clothes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Manaia has requested a loan to buy a design board, sponges, paints, materials, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, sponges, a design board, materials, etc.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1976. She is living in a rural area. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a teacher. Sayora is a generous, brave and helpful person. She was a participant of the “Women entrepreneur – achieve success” training. She was nominated to get a certificate. She got a huge number of accessible types for making new business. She wants to open her business in one of the spheres of a business. 

Now she is planning to buy clothes, shoes and all necessary things for kids, for opening a new business. She is confident of the idea of opening her own business. She is hoping to make a better standard of living for her family. Sayora is requesting financial support to buy a collection of clothes, shoes and things for kids, to open her new business.

loans.use: to buy a collection of clothes, shoes and things for kids, to open her new business.

loans.name: Soteria

texts.en: Soteria is 28 years old and married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, an oven and a fryer. In the future, Soteria hopes to expand her business and to save more for her children's education. She joined SPBD in January this year 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, an oven and a fryer.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang would like to take a further loan to buy more soft-drinks to sell from her stall. Trang's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more soft-drinks to sell from her stall

loans.name: Abelin

texts.en:
Abelin is 25 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Abelin is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Abelin requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Abelin has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Abelin would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Bong

texts.en: Bong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Ajat

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of Ruma’s agents, Ajat. This is the third time he is asking a loan from Kiva. 

Ajat lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only child. Ajat works as a guard for a villa located near his house. He joined Ruma two years ago. He wanted to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to start up a business, as well as contribute more to his community. His community sees him as a trusted mobile service provider and he has a friendly and cheerful personality as well.

Now, Ajat is becoming an agent of Ruma’s product called Mapan. Mapan is an e-commerce product for lower communities. By serving Mapan to his customers, Ajat will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Ajat will simply send an SMS in a format to the SMS center and then the customer will pay him. Then, Ruma’s agent will come to him to collect the money, and within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to the customer's door.

As the business grows, Ajat is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful in helping Ajat to improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Ajat is the one who is sitting and holding a Mapan poster. He is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Balimayaton Group

texts.fr:
Madou est l'homme qui a tendu sa main vers le bœuf sur la photo.
Madou est Malien, âgé de 43 ans, marié et père de 9 enfants dont 5 vont à l’école, leurs Age varie entre 1 à 5 ans. Il fait l’embouche Bovine sa femme est ménagère mais exerce comme activité génératrice de revenue la vente des condiments pour survenir à ses petits besoins.
Pour améliorer son activité afin d’acheter beaucoup de bœufs pour engraisser, il a fait recourt au RMCR pour prendre de l’argent. Il s’approvisionne dans une foire locale et revend dans la même foire. Madou achète les bœufs maigres les engraisse pour les revendre il  peut avoir souvent comme bénéfice 100 000FCFA sur la vente d’un animal en fin d’activité sur une période de 6 mois. Il exerce cette activité depuis plus de douze ans, il est alphabétisé en langue nationale. Il prend en charge les frais scolaire de ses enfants, leurs habillement et leurs frais de santé.
texts.en:
Madou is the man holding his hand toward the cow in the picture.
Madou is a 43 year old Malian man, married and the father of 9 children, 5 of whom attend school. Their ages vary from 1-5 years old. He fattens cows and his wife is a shepherdess but also sells condiments on the side as an income-generating activity to meet her personal needs.
In order to grow his business and purchase lots of cows to fatten, he came to RMCR to take a loan. he purchases animals in the local market and resells at the same market. He purchases cows when they're thin and fattens them for sale. He can often make a 100,000 Franc ($200) profit when he sells an animal at the end of working with it for 6 months. He has had this business for more than 12 years, and reads and writes the national language (Bambara). He provides for his children's school fees, clothing and health costs.

loans.use: to buy thin cows to fatten and resell

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Nouhoum est le monsieur qui a un légume  (courgette) en main sur la photo. Nouhoum est un brave homme Malien, marié, âgé de 64 ans et père de huit (08) enfants dont quatre (04) sont scolarisés, 01 fréquente l’école coranique, 01 a abandonné l’école. Sa femme vend les condiments (gombo et  sel).
Nouhoum n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école mais aime beaucoup travailler,  il fait le jardinage pendant la saison sèche en plus l’élevage de bœufs. Il fait recourt aux services financiers du RMCR pour acheter plus de semences pour le jardinage dans le but de les vendre pour générer plus de profil.
Avec le prêt du RMCR il s’approvisionne aux marchés de sa localité où il réside (semence, raccord, les produits de traitement contre les prédateurs). Il compte creuser un puits dans son jardin et souhaite l’encercler avec le grillage parce que jusque là il coupe les branches d’arbres pour entourer son jardin chose négative pour la nature.
Après la récolte il vend ses produits (piment, choux, tomate, courgette) son revenu varie entre 25 000 F et plus  après chaque vente. Nouhoum exerce cette activité il y a plus de quarante (40) ans et il rencontre certains obstacles le manque d’eau, la mévente parfois la surproduction qui fait chuter le cout des prix sur le marché.
texts.en:
Nouhoum is the gentleman who has a vegetable (a zucchini) in his hand in the photo. Nouhoum is a stalwart Malian man who is married, 64 years old and the father of 8 children, 4 of whom attend school, 1 attends Koranic school, and 1 quit school. His wife sells condiments (salt and bullion). 
Nouhoum didn't have the opportunity to attend school but loves to work. He is a gardener during the dry season, and also raises cows. He comes to RMCR for financial services in order to purchase more seeds for gardening in order to sell them to generate more profit.
With the loan from RMCR, he makes his purchases in his area (seeds, hoses, pesticides). He would like to create a well in his garden and put up a metal fence around the garden because until now, he has fenced it off with branches, which is bad for the environment.
After the harvest he sells his products (pepper, cabbage, tomato and zucchini) and his profits amount to about 25,000 Francs ($50) or more with each sale. Nouhoum has had this business for more than 40 years and he encounters certain challenges such as lack of water, price fluctuation due to overproduction, which causes the market value of his crops to decrease.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and other products for gardening

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr: Djiki est l’homme qui tient la corde de la vache en main sur la photo. Djiki  est malien, âgé de 63 ans marié, père de 3 enfants dont  un est scolarisé, sa femme est ménagère. Il a quitté l’école très tôt. Il entreprend  l’élevage de bovins. Il exerce  cette activité depuis  des années  et pour acheter plus de bœufs, il  fait recourt au RMCR pour prendre de l’argent. Il achète ses vaches et bœufs dans les marchés locaux. Il vend ses bovins dans les mêmes marchés. Souvent il est confronté à des problèmes tels que la chute de prix des animaux, la peste bovine. Il dispose un endroit  en bois pour la garde des animaux.  Son  objectif est de clôturer son enclos en dure pour bien sécuriser ses bovins .Les bénéfices   lui  permettra de payer les intrants agricole, de supporter les charges de sa  famille.
texts.en: Djiki is the man holding the cow's leash in his hand in the photo. Djiki is a 63 year old Malian man who is married and the father of 3 children, one of whom attends school. His wife is a shepherdess. He left school very early. He raises cattle. He has had this business for several years. In order to purchase more cows, he came to RMCR for funds. He purchases his cows in the local markets. He sells his cows in the same markets. Often he has to deal with problems such as price fluctuation or bovine illnesses. He has an enclosure made of wood where he keeps his animals. His goal is to make his enclosure more secure in order to protect his cows. The profits he makes allow him to pay for agricultural inputs, and to pay his family's living costs.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Amna Bibi

texts.en:
Amna bibi is 31 years old, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a butcher shop for the past ten years; he is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

Amna bibi's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., meat, beef and other products for his business. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all of these products for resale. Therefore, Amna bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Amna bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy meat and other products for her husband's butcher shop.

loans.name: Sabunyuma Group

texts.fr:
Fatoumata est la dame au milieu des deux autres membres du groupe tenant des torches dans les deux mains su la photo.
Fatoumata âgée de 43 ans, est une commerçante Malienne, scolarisée, mère de trois enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Son mari est un pharmacien. Elle prend de l’argent au RMCR pour acheter des cartons de torches, des sacs de riz. Elle vend au comptant les torches et décortique les sacs de riz pour les revendre. , elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés urbains et sert de fournisseur dans les marchés locaux d’où elle gagne un profit mensuel acceptable qui lui permet d’habiller, de nourrir, de contribuer aux frais scolaires de ses enfants à l’école. Souvent elle est confrontée à un  obstacle, la mévente.
Elle souhaite  avoir plus d’argent pour acheter encore plus pour sacs de riz et de cartons de torches pour revendre a plusieurs clients, elle  veut faire face au bien- être de ses enfants.
texts.en: Fatoumata is the woman in the center of the other two group members who holds flashlights in both of her hands in the picture. Fatoumata is 43 years old, Malian and a trader. She went to school and is the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom attended school. Her husband is a pharmacist. She has taken a loan from RMCR to purchase boxes of flashlights and sacks of rice. She retails the flashlights and divides up the sacks of rice in order to resell. She purchases her stick in the urban markets and wholesales in the local markets where she makes an acceptable monthly profit allowing her to clothe, feed and contribute to the school fees of her school-age children. Often she faces price fluctuations. She would like to have more funds to purchase more rice and flashlights to resell to more clients. She would like to provide for her children's well-being.

loans.use: to buy flashlights and sacks of rice to resell

loans.name: Zohir

texts.en: Zohir is a wise man. He was born in 1970. He is living in a remote district and is married with  three children. His wife is working abroad. He is a taxi driver. He serves people by transferring water in his own car. He has been working for about sixteen years. He was a participant of a three day training where he learned a lot about how to start a new business. He wants to open a business in the sphere of agriculture. He wants to buy four small cattle to keep them and then sell in a domestic market. He feels responsibility for his family to keep them safe and feed them. He is planning to open a new business and make better their standard of living. Zohir is asking for financial support from KIVA to buy a cattle.

loans.use: to buy four small cattle.

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia is 44 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling chips in her community and has been doing this for three years. Silia has requested a loan to buy oil, banana, taro, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Silia will extend her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy oil, banana, taro, etc.

loans.name: Kiri

texts.en: Kiri is 23 years old and single with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling B.B.Q in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken legs, sausages, bananas, soya, plastic plates, etc. In the future, Kiri hopes to extend her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken legs, sausage, bananas, soya, plastic plates, etc.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is a 34 year old woman who has a partner and one child. She runs a business selling goods like tinned fish, sugar, flour, oil, rice, etc in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Telesia has requested a loan to buy sacks of sugar, flour, boxes of tinned fish, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, flour, boxes of tinned fish, etc.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 37 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living through raising mushrooms and selling. 

She started her business two years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying more materials for raising mushrooms to satisfy her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more materials for raising mushrooms.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien is 50 years old and married with two children. He lives with his family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. He earns a living through raising mushrooms and selling. 

He started his business one year ago. He intends to take a loan to gradually expand his business by buying more materials for raising mushroom to satisfy his customers. 

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more materials for raising mushroom to satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien, 44, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two daughters. Her husband earns a living making iron doors. She started the business selling roasted pork to generate income for raising her children. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality food products for selling. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy better quality food products for selling

loans.name: Tilek

texts.ru: Тилек, 33 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Тилек среднее образование, она работает уборщицей в детском саду, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Тилек на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 1 лошадь и 15 овец. На участке мерою 2,0 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает люцерну и ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тилек обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 жеребят. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Tilek is 33 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary education and she works as a cleaning lady in a preschool.  In order to bring home an additional income, she and her husband are also involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  They started in this field ten years ago with an initial capital of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, Tilek now owns two cows, one horse and 15 sheep.  She also grows alfalfa and barley on two hectares of her own land and one hectare of leased land.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase four foals.  She is planning to use the earnings from this loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase four foals in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Salamatkan

texts.ru: Саламаткан, 44 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Саламаткан среднее образование. Она по характеру: отзывчивая, ответственная и трудолюбивая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет Саламаткан занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 6 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Саламаткан, в хозяйстве имеется: 2 коровы. Ее деятельность приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саламаткан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка и 2 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, хочет заготовить сено и накопить на обучение ее сына в университете.
texts.en: Salamatkan is 44 years old, married, and she has four children.  She has a secondary education.  By nature, she is friendly, responsible and hardworking.  She has been working in animal husbandry for several years already, thus providing her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business six years ago and, thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows on her farm.  Her activity brings her a monthly income of about 8,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, Salamatkan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy one calf and two sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming business.  She also wants to gather hay and to save enough money to send her son to college.

loans.use: to purchase one calf and two sheep in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Tazagul

texts.ru: Тазагул 34 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Уже много лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Тазагул достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме до 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Тазагул имеется 2 коровы, 6 овец. По хозяйству помогают супруг и дети. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Тазагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве и накопить на постройку дома для ее сына.
texts.en: Tazagul is 34 years old, married, and she has three children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for many years already.  Thanks to her very hard work and constant labor, she has achieved great progress and has come to the point where she now makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  She currently has two cows and six sheep on her farm.  Her husband and children also help her to run the business.  In order to further grow their farming business, Tazagul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her cattle headcount and to save enough money to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is 40 years old, and a mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession; he sells fruits like apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Sobia's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for selling purposes, so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profits. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not able to purchase fruits for his business purposes. Therefore, Sobia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase items to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crockery for her husband's cooking work.

loans.name: Ever Miguel

texts.es:
Hoy es el día, esta es la oportunidad, es momento de estar sonriente, alegre de abrazar a la esposa, a los hijos  y esto es lo que siente Ever que gracias a la ayuda que tendrá de Interactuar y a la buena disposición de los prestadores de Kiva, podrá tener el negocio de sus sueños que será un cría de peces.
Para que entienda un poco a Ever,  siempre ha sido empleado, ganaba muy poco, lo suficiente para llevar alimento en su hogar, donde lo esperan su pareja y tres hijos.
Pero con este apoyo tendrá su propio negocio el cual aprendió desde pequeño, y con el capital que prestando comprara alevino que son peces pequeños, y alimento.
Tu puedes ser partícipe de un cambio radical de un empresario que con este proyecto busca mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar, lograr que sus hijos estudien y tener las puertas del progreso abiertas.
texts.en:
Today is the day; this is the opportunity. It is the moment to be smiling, happy to embrace one's wife and children. This is what Ever feels, thanks to the assistance that he will have from Interacturar and the good will of the lenders of Kiva. He will be able to have the business of his dreams: a fish farm.

To understand a bit about Ever, he has always been an employee, and earned very little: just sufficient to bring home food to his home, where his wife and three children awaited him. But with this loan, he will have his own business, which he learned from an early age.  With the capital loaned to him, he will buy fish larvae and food. You can be a participant in a significant change for a small business man who, with this project, is hoping to improve the living conditions in his home, insure that his children get an education and open the doors to progress.

loans.use: buy fish larvae and fish food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 30 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband has been running a zarri cosmetics business for the past 12 years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Asia's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g cream, face wash, rubber bands and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all of these products for reselling purpose. Therefore Asia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 

Asia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to increase his business.

loans.name: Iris Janeth

texts.es: Iris, tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada, vive junto a dos de sus  hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Puerto, Cortes. Hace 9 años que se dedica a la venta de comida rápida en una escuela de la comunidad donde vende pollo frito con tajadas, tacos, baleadas, enchiladas, agua, refrescos, dulces, galletas, jugos etc. este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Está solicitando el tercer ciclo de préstamo en la institución y es por 15,000 lempiras, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para elaborar comidas y golosinas, como ser harina de maíz, vegetales, carnes, condimentos, refrescos, golosinas, etc. para mantener variedad de productos y obtener ingresos que ayuden a su familia. Su plan es mantener siempre surtido su negocio para aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Iris, 41, is married and lives together with two of her children in a village in the municipality of Puerto, Cortes. For nine years, she's sold fast food in a school in the community where she sells fried chicken with plantains, tacos, baleadas [a typical Honduran dish consisting of a wheat flour tortilla stuffed with refried beans, eggs, avocado, meat and cheese], enchiladas, water, drinks, sweets, cakes, juices, etc. 

This business is Iris's source of income for helping her family. This is her third cycle of loans with this institution, for 15,000 lempiras, to invest in the purchase of goods to make food and candies such as corn flour, vegetables, meats, condiments, drinks, sweets, etc, in order to maintain a variety of products and earn an income to help her family. Her plan is to always keep her store stocked, in order to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, vegetables, meats, condiments, drinks, juices, and candy to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay the expenses for her husband to set up his tailoring shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband purchase potatoes and onions in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her husband's general store

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is a generous woman. She was born in 1985, and she is living in a small town. She is married and has three children. She had a business of keeping livestock during last seven years. She planned to renovate her house. She sold her livestock to make the renovations. 

After the renovation, she thought to start a new business. She participated in training and felt responsibility to help her husband with finances to feed their family. She has an idea of trading dry fruits. Nilufar wants to get a loan from Kiva project to buy dry fruits and open her own business.

loans.use: to buy dry fruits to open her business.

loans.name: Hesusa

texts.en: Hesusa is 28 years old and the mother of four children. She and her family live in a rural community, and she manages a small retail store to help her husband cover family expenses. She has been in this business for almost three years, and would like to make her business more profitable in order to gain a higher income. Due to a lack of capital, she has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy more items to sell, including mineral water, soft drinks, canned goods, breads, beverages, candies, laundry soaps and seasonings. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Sumaira Parveen

texts.en: Sumaira Parveen is 30 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has a daughter and her husband earns a living by running a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all of its members, but Sumaira Parveen has been running a beauty salon for past four years in order to help her husband meet household expenses. She is requesting this loan to buy different types of supplies, including creams, hairbrushes, and other items. Unfortunately, she is unable to pay for these items with money on hand, and is requesting a Kiva loan to cover their cost. These items will help her provide better services to her customers and earn more profits. Sumaira Parveen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to expand her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plumbing tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory for her brother's general store

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.en: Rukhshona is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1985 and she is living in a small town. She has three children and her husband is an emigrant. Her husband left for Russia to earn some money in order to feed the family. Rukhshona was a teacher at a secondary school. Unfortunately, the school was closed and she needed to find a new place of work. Successfully, she was participant of a training and she learned how to start a new business. She has an idea to open a business in the sector of food trading. She wants to buy and sell dried fruits in a domestic market. She requested financial support from Kiva to buy dried fruits for her startup business.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for her startup business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her son's lathe machine and to buy cutting tools to renew and manufacture spare parts of vehicles.

loans.name: Shehnaz Bibi

texts.en: Shehnaz Bibi is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and has three years' experience. For the past several days her husband is free and is not generating income. Therefore, he wants to buy a new rickshaw so that he can generate any amount of income. He wants to purchase it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of purchasing a rickshaw. Therefore, Shehnaz Bibi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing a rickshaw.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy a rickshaw and increase his business

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Cruz, una morena muy trabajadora, preocupada pero sobretodo humilde y necesitada de ayuda que busca iniciar un negocio de venta de dulces, frituras en empaquetes, galletas y panes con el fin de poder tener un medio de sustento para ella y sus dos hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad.
Cruz pide de manera muy encarecida, un apoyo para darle forma a su idea de negocio, comprando estantería, y surtido de productos anteriormente mencionados, pues ya tiene un local que ha ido adaptando poco a poco, lo que da fe de sus buenas intenciones de y ganas que tiene para montar el negocio.
texts.en:
This is Cruz, lady with a dark complexion, who is hard-working, concerned about others, and above all, humble.  She needs help to start a business selling treats, assorted chips, cookies, and bread, with the goal of having a means of support for herself and her two children, ages 11 and 9.

Cruz is earnestly requesting a loan to make her business idea a reality by purchasing shelving and a supply of the above-mentioned products. She already has a shop that she has been adapting gradually, which attests to her good intentions and her desire to open the business.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of cookies and assorted chips in order to start a business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also does farming. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are of all kinds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a married woman. She has five children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of products. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has three children whose ages range from 4 to 12 years. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a reliable area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be storage. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. Her business goal is to be a major distributor of milk within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own more dairy cows. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also does farming. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are of all kinds.

Mary says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with four children ranging in age from two years to 15 years. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soft drinks, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her primary customers are locals.

Eunice says that her biggest business challenge is having low stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to replenish her stock of sugar, soap, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more sugar, soap, flour and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: help her husband to fix his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband buy a new rickshaw body to continue his transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Seth

texts.en: Seth is a single woman. She operates an M-PESA business where she offers mobile-phone-based money-transfer services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to add M-PESA float. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand the business.

loans.use: to add M-PESA float

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman and has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the rainy season, which affects business. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a distributor within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a clinic. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a reliable place and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more medicine. His business goal is to be the main clinic in the area he operates within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved standards of living. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more medicine

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a posho mill. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. His business goal is to own a cereals store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved standards of living. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a married woman. She has nine children. She describes herself to be faithful and loyal. She operates rental houses. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a secure area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy tiles and paint to renovate the houses. Her business goal is to build more houses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy tiles and paint to renovate the houses

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to be a large scale supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a role model in business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Mehrinigor

texts.en: Mehrinigor is a married woman. She is from the northern part of her country. She says that she has made a living in agriculture since she was very young and that she used to work as a day laborer. She learned from this work and dedicated herself to planting small gardens of agricultural products. She is working hard and tries to buy fungicides to keep her crops healthy, as she aspires to have a good harvest and to keep planting in greater quantities, all to help her husband with the finances. She has been busy with this business for about 17 years. She wants to educate her son. She is planning to send her son abroad. She needs to buy a ticket for his flight. Mehrinigor is asking for financial support to buy a ticket. She awaits the Kiva  members' mercy.

loans.use: To buy an airline ticket for her son

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a poultry business. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more poultry. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful supplier of poultry. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en: Gregory is a married man. He has three children. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy carpentry materials. His business goal is to open more branches within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enhance her husband's scrap work

loans.name: Knight

texts.en: Knight is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be a risk taker. She operates a beauty salon. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are ladies. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have two beauty salons within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open another salon. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a married man with seven children. He describes himself as reliable. He operates a garage where he repairs vehicles, and he has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in an area with high customer inflow.

Ibrahim says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy garage equipment. His business goal is to open another garage within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self sustainable.

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to buy garage equipment

loans.name: Jose De La Rosa

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 37 años, campesino por naturaleza que anteriormente se desempeñaba como mayordomo en diferentes finca. 
Hoy gracias a la incursión de la corporación Interactuar en su territorio puede soñar, puede aspirar a mejores cosas para su pareja y sus dos hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad, pues tendrá la oportunidad de crear su empresa, un proyecto que ha venido realizando poco a poco pero que no ha podido finalizar por falta de capital.
Como se puede ver en la foto el señor José ha estado construyendo un estadero para albergar pollos, pero necesita algunos materiales más, pollos y alimento y es esa la razón que lo lleva a solicitar un crédito para la compra de estas piezas restantes y poder arrancar lo más rápido con el negocio que significara el sustento de su familia, su mejora de vida, y del futuro de sus hijos y José te invita a que participes en su reforma de vida.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old.  He is a farmer by nature, and he has worked as a manager on different farms before.  Today, thanks to the coming of Interactuar to his territory, he can dream, and aspire to better things for his wife and their two children, ages 12 and 7, as he will have the opportunity to create his company. 

It is a project that he has been working toward gradually, but has not been able to complete due to a lack of capital.  As seen in the photo, Señor José has been building a poultry house for sheltering chickens, but he needs some more materials, chickens, and feed. 

That is the reason that led him to request a loan in order to purchase these remaining items and be able to get started with the business as quickly as possible. It means sustenance for his family, a better life, and the future of his children. José invites you to participate in the transformation of his life.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a poultry house.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée en Mai 2011 et regroupant 20 membres qui habitent tous dans le même village.Elle mène comme activité principale le commerce. 

Mariama,se trouvant assis a droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle est âgée de 53 ans,mariée et mére de six enfants dont trois garçons et trois filles.Elle effectue le commerce comme activité principale.

Pour son crédit,elle compte acheter 02 pots de bonbon sucette à 4500f dont 2250f le pot,05 sachets de swing gum à 5000f, 05 sachets de menthe fraiche à 5000f, 05 sachets menthe fraiche noire à 5000f, 10 sachets de vitalait à 15000f le total et des condiments d'une valeur de 15500f.

Pour son bénéfice,elle souhaite renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2011 and is composed of 20 members living in the same village. They mainly work as vendors.
Mariama, the one on the right raising her hand in the photo, is our star borrower. She is 53 years old, married and has six children: three sons and three daughters. She makes a living by working as a vendor.

She plans to use her loan to buy two jars of lollipops at 2250 West African francs per jar, five packs of chewing gum at 5,000 francs, five packs of fresh mint at 5,000 francs, five packs of fresh black mint at 5,000 francs five packs of Vitalait milk containers at 15,000 francs. In totla, she will buy merchandise valued at 15,500 francs. She would like to use her revenues for bolstering her savings.

loans.use: to buy food items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her son to purchase a new motorized rickshaw.

loans.name: Mehwish Binaras

texts.en:
Mehwish Binaras is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twelve years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Having insufficient financial means, he is unable to pay for the needed maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Mehwish Binaras has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Mehwish Binaras's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And this will enable him to provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. Mehwish Binaras  also plans to save some of the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Mehwish Binaras is very grateful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.es: Ana una mujer de 51 años de edad, madre de tres y que actualmente vive con su pareja en unión libre, desea obtener la ayuda de ustedes la razón es que todo el dinero para comida, pago de servicios públicos, educación los da su pareja y ella está cansada de sentirse solo como una ama de casa, quiere tener un negocio propio para generar sus propios ingresos por si en algún momento falta su pareja tenga toda la capacidad de asumir los gastos de su familia. Po tal motivo solicita un préstamo para iniciar su negocio de cría de cerdos, el cual invertirá en la compra de cerdos, alimento para los animales y adecuación de cocheras, tu apoyo ayudara a una empresaria a tener independencia económica de su pareja.
texts.en:
Ana, a woman of 51 and a mother of three, lives with her common-law husband.  She wants to obtain your assistance; the reason is that her husband gives her all the money for food, public services, and education, and she is tired of feeling that she is only a housewife.

She wants to have her own business in order to generate her own income so that she will be capable of covering her family’s expenses in case her husband is unable to do so at some point.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to start her business, raising pigs.  She will invest it the purchase of pigs, animal feed, and setting up pig pens. Your support will help a woman entrepreneur to be financially independent of her spouse.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and animal feed, and set up pig pens.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Emanuel Group

texts.es: Doña Maria de la Cruz, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en  el municipio de Yoro junto a su esposo y dos de sus hijos. Doña María lleva 12 años de generar sus propios ingresos elaborando y vendiendo tortillas de maíz, pan y venta de cosméticos como cremas, lociones, productos de belleza etc. Para tener este negocio ha solicitado varios préstamos en la institución, actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 lempiras para la compra de harina de maíz, huevos, leche, manteca y leña para la elaboración de tortillas y pan y compra de cosméticos par la venta. Su plan es poder comprar los productos de contado para vender a mejor precio y aumentar las ventas, asimismo las ganancias para ayudar a su familia. Este prestamo es en forma de grupo el cual se llama Mujeres de la Emanuel, formado por 7 personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a varios negocios como es la elaboración y venta de tortillas, pan, venta de mercadería, ropa, elaboración de muebles, venta de  plásticos etc. El prestamo grupal es por 92,000 lempiras. En la foto se identifican: a la izquierda está Laura, Maria de la Cruz, María Roberta, María Verónica, Karen, Bessy y Aquilina.
texts.en:
Doña Maria de la Cruz is 55 years old, is married and has four kids. She lives in the town of Yoro with her husband and their two sons. Doña María has taken 12 years generating her own income making and selling corn tortillas and bread. She also sells cosmetics such as creams, lotions, and beauty products, etc. To have this business she has applied for various loans in the institution, and is presently asking for another 15,000 lempiras to buy cornmeal, eggs, milk, butter and firewood to make tortillas and bread and buy cosmetics to sell. Her plan is to be able to buy the products with cash to sell at a better price and increase her sales and the proceeds to help her family. 
This loan is in the form of a group which is called Mujeres de la Emanuel, formed by 7 people who live in the same community and make a living through various businesses such as the development and sale of tortillas, bread, sale of merchandise, apparel, furniture making, sale of plastic, etc. The group loan is for 92,000 lempiras. In the photo pictured from the left: Laura, Maria de la Cruz, María Roberta, María Verónica, Karen, Bessy and Aquilina.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal, eggs, milk, butter and firewood for making tortillas and bread and to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Elina Esther

texts.es:
Elina es una mujer de 48 años de edad, sonriente y entusiasta que desea iniciar un negocio de confección directa, su motivo es principalmente una necesidad que hay en su hogar, pues pasan necesidades por ser una familia grande, conformada por 4 hijos y su esposo.
Elina quiere mostrar sentido de responsabilidad, y de ayuda por tal razón solicita un crédito para la compra de una máquina de coser y telas  para iniciar rápidamente su negocio aspirando a mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Elina is a 48 year old woman, smiling and enthusiastic and wanting to start a direct preparation business. Her motive is primarily a necessity that she has in her home and the needs of being a large family formed of four kids and her husband.
Elina wants to show a sense of responsibility, and for that reason she asks for a loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric to quickly start her business. She is aiming to improve the living conditions in her home.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric to quickly start her business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 27 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y trabaja como transportista.
Él es emprendedor, decidido, constante, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’; un área rural caracterizada por mantenerse como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, hasta en los distritos urbanos. Maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo se producen. También tienen granjas de pollos e incluso se trabaja en la apicultura. De clima cálido semi-tropical durante todo el año.
Roberto es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que se dedican a la agricultura, viven en una casa propia en obra gruesa que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Él se dedica a trabajar como transportista, comenzó como ayudante de transporte interdepartamental hasta que adquirió experiencia y se independizó. Durante 6 años viene construyendo su casa, poco a poco y ladrillo a ladrillo; logró construir dos habitaciones una cocina, un baño y lavandería, el siguiente paso es la instalación de agua potable, actualmente recoge agua de un pozo manualmente con un balde. “Aquí en Sacaba escasea el agua, antes comprábamos agua del camión cisterna, luego construimos un pozo y ahora soñamos con tener agua potable…” comenta. Su sueño es ver terminada la construcción de su casa, y desea realizar una inversión en la instalación de agua potable para su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle a su familia una vida segura. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que trabaja independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Roberto solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable, a su cocina, baño y lavandería para darles a sus padres un sitio seguro y cómodo donde vivir.
texts.en:
Roberto is a 27 year old single man with no children who works as a driver. He is an entrepreneur, purposeful, constant, strong, responsible and very hard working. He does his work in the town of Sacaba, a rural area known for being the city granary because of its production of cereals, vegetables and fruits, even in the urban districts.

They produce corn, wheat, barley, vegetables, strawberries, plantains, papayas, oranges, apples, peaches and even tumbo plants. They also have chicken coops and keep bees. They have a warm, semi-tropical climate year round. 

Roberto is short and dark skinned with short, black hair. His native tongue is Quechua which he speaks at home and he speaks Spanish for work and the general culture. He shares his life with his parents who work in agriculture. They live in their own heavy duty home that has electricity and well water.

He works as a driver. He began as an interdepartamental transport assistant until he gained experience and became independent. He has been building his home for 6 years, little by little, brick by brick. He managed to construct two rooms, a kitchen, a bathroom and a laundry area. The next step is the installation of potable water. Currently, he gathers water manually with a bucket from a well. “Water is scarce here in Sacaba. Previously, we would buy our water from a tanker truck, then we constructed a well and now we dream of having potable water” he says.

His dream is to see the construction of his home completed and he wishes to invest in the installation of potable water for his kitchen, bathroom and laundry area to give his family a secure life.

This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 6 years that he has worked independently.

It is for these reasons that Roberto is requesting a loan to connect potable water to his kitchen, bathroom and laundry area to give his parents a secure and comfortable place to live.

loans.use: to connect potable water to his kitchen, bathroom and laundry area and to give his parents a secure and comfortable place to live.

loans.name: Leidys Luz

texts.es:
Ella es Leidys una madre soltera muy joven y golpeada por la pobreza, vive en el municipio de montería donde las oportunidades de empleo son muy pocas, su pareja la abandono y la dejo sola con su hijo.
Desesperada sin saber que hacer no encontraba trabajo, pero llego a Montería una corporación sin ánimo de lucro dispuesta a ayudar a personas a crear empresa.
Con la ayuda de esta empresa la cual es Interactuar Leidys va a solicitar un préstamo para empezar a ofertar servicios de salón de belleza, inicialmente comprara, una silla para motilar, secadora, plancha para el cabello y un pequeño surtido de tintas.
texts.en:
This is Leidys, a very young single mother who has been hit hard by poverty.  She lives in the municipality of Montería where there are very few job opportunities.  Her partner abandoned her and left her alone with their son. 

She was desperate and did not know what to do; she could not find work.  However, a nonprofit corporation came to Montería ready to help people start businesses. 

With the help of this business, which is called Interactuar, Leidys is going to request a loan to start offering beauty salon services.  She will start off by buying a styling chair, a hair dryer, a flat iron, and a small stock of dyes.

loans.use: to buy flat irons, chairs, and dyes.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell. Her business goal is to be an hotel manager within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be caring. 

He operates a M-Pesa business where he offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. He has been involved in this business for four years. 

His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to add M-Pesa float (stored-value credits for sale in mobile money service). 

His business goal is to have more business branches within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add M-Pesa float

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and stitching material for her own work

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Salsamentarías y venta de carnes frías y productos desechables es el negocio con el que  genera ingresos Daniel de 32 años, quien habita para su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 13 años. Su idea de negocio surgió fortalecida por su propia experiencia como empleado y su capacidad de ahorrar mientras trabajaba en una salsamentaría del pueblo donde aún vive, pero en otro sector. Sus ventas las realiza de contado de 8 a 6 de la tarde, porque se propone alcanzar sus metas actuales que son mejorar las condiciones de su negocio para impactar positivamente su imagen y lograr una mayor calidad de vida para su familia. En la actualidad Daniel está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual le permitirá comprar salsas, carnes frías, productos desechables en mayor volumen; con esta inversión sus inventarios aumentarán y así mismo el impactarán sus ventas, que es el punto al que quiere llegar y al mismo tiempo estaría solucionado su desafío de conseguir fuentes de financiación efectivas, que se ajusten a sus posibilidades lo cual ha logrado con su credikiva..
texts.en: Selling deli products, cold meats, and disposable goods is how Daniel, 32, earns his living.  He lives with his family, which is made up of his partner and their three children, who range from 8 to 13 years old.  His business idea was strengthened by his experience as an employee and his ability to save while he was working at a delicatessen in the town where he still lives, though in a different neighborhood.  He does his sales in cash from 8 to 6 in the afternoon because he wants to achieve his current goals, which are to improve the setup of his business to have a positive impact on his image and to achieve a better quality of life for his family.  Daniel is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so he can buy sauces, cold meats, and disposable products in greater volume.  This investment will increase his inventory and also impact his sales, which is where he wants to get, and it would also solve the problem of finding cash financing that adapts to his possibilities, which is what his Kiva loan has done.

loans.use: to buy sauces, cold meats, and disposable products

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José es un hombre del campo, muy luchador, trabajar, casero, dedicado a su familia, tiene una esposa y fruto de su matrimonio nacieron dos hijos los cuales sostiene gracias a su actividad principal la cual es la cría de animales, cerdos y pollos para ser más específicos.
Esta actividad por lo general se desarrolló de forma tradicional, se casan los animales, se alimentos con cuido o concentrado, y se albergan en pequeñas cocheras construidas de plástico y madera, pero los tiempos cambian y hay que adaptarse a lo del momento. Una de las principales dificultades que están teniendo los criadores de animales, es que los fuertes cambios climáticos están cavando con la vida de sus animales, y esto es un llamado a renovarse a construir cocheras más firmes, con mejores materiales, por dicha razón José quiere solicitar un crédito para reformar sus cocheras y comprar alimento para sus pollos y cerdos aspirando que con las reformas no sufra más muertes.
texts.en:
José is a man from the countryside; he is very determined, hardworking, and he is a homebody who is dedicated to his family.  He has a wife and his marriage has produced two children he supports through his main business, which is raising animals, pigs and chickens to be more specific. 

He generally carries out his business in the traditional way: the animals are paired up, nurtured with feed, and housed in small sheds made of plastic and wood.  However, times change and you have to keep up with what is current.  One of the main difficulties animal breeders are facing is that significant climate changes are affecting their animals' lives, and this is a call to update and build stronger sheds with better materials.  This is why José wants to request a loan; so he can rebuild his sheds and buy feed for his chickens and pigs in hopes that after these upgrades there won't be any more deaths.

loans.use: to buy feed for his chickens and pigs

loans.name: Shaarkul

texts.ru: Шааркул, 58 лет, замужем, есть 23 летний сын. У Шааркул высшее образование, работает в санитарной эпидемиологической станции, также уже 23 года она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Шааркул имеется 3,15 ГА собственного земельного надела, на котором она ежегодно выращивает люцерну и ячмень для реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 5 овец, на ежедневной основе она сдает молоко. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Шааркул составляет до 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на поездку к родственникам в город Бишкек.
texts.en: Shaarkul is 58 years, married, and has a 23-year old son. Shaarkul has a college degree and works for the local Department of Hygiene and Epidemiology. In addition, for 23 years she has been growing farm crops and raising livestock. She started with 10,000 KGS. Thanks to Shaarkul's hard work, at present she owns a land plot of 3.15 ha [7.8 acres], where she annually grows sainfoin [a plant used for animal forage] and barley for sale. She also has two cows and five sheep and sells milk on a daily basis. Her monthly revenue reaches up to 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Shaarkul has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance organization for a loan in the amount of 35,000 KGS to buy steers. She would like to use the resulting revenues for an additional increase of livestock. She also plans to save up for a trip to the city of Bishkek, where she has relatives.

loans.use: to purchase additional steers to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be hardworking. 

He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and charcoal. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a busy market and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and charcoal to enable him open a new business outlet. His business goal is to buy a pick up to supply charcoal to other areas and have more stores within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be the leading charcoal supplier in the area. 

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and charcoal to enable him open a new business outlet

loans.name: Motlus

texts.en:
Motlus is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be good. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a marketable place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be motorcycle breakdown. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another motorcycle . His business goal is to own a motor vehicle within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 8 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be loyal. 

She operates a beauty  salon. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KEs 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products . Her business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes which affect transport. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Sajida Parveen

texts.en:
Sajida Parveen is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. 

Her husband has been running his own business of garments for four years. He alone is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes.
