Therefore Sajida Parveen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Sajida Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's garments business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Maria Gigliola

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 46 años de edad, muy tierna, simpática, con gran amor y cariño por los niños, tiene una guardería, oficio que aprendió tomando clases y la cual presenta una dificultad y es que no cuenta con espacio suficiente para albergar los niños que quieren matricularse este año.
Esta guardería es muy solicitada en el barrio debido a la cercanía y el bajo costo, haciendo posible que los padres puedan dejar sus hijos e irse tranquilos a trabajar.
Para no dejar ningún niño desamparado y poder acogerlos a todos bajo su amoroso brazo, María solicita un crédito para ampliar su espacio, cumpliendo con las normas para tener 10 niños más.
texts.en:
María is a 46-year-old woman.  She is very sweet and nice, and really loves and cares about children.  María has her own nursery, a trade she learned by taking classes.  The nursery presents a difficulty, in that she does not have enough space to accommodate the children who want to enroll this year.
This nursery is very popular in the neighborhood due to its proximity and low cost, making it possible for parents to leave their children and go to work without worrying about their care.  In order to leave no child without safe day care, and to welcome them all into her warm embrace, Maria is requesting a loan to expand her space in such a way as to meet the requirements to have 10 more children in her nursery.

loans.use: to extend the size of her business, including renovation and repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Bachaa Sultana

texts.en:
Bachaa Sultana is 44 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son is fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits e.g. apples, bananas, grapes, etc.
 
Bachaa Sultana's son needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes.
Therefore, Bachaa Sultana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her son to purchase the above items for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son purchase fruits to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the inflation of prices. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, soap, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, soap, flour and other items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 to 11 years old. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal and firewood. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Ruphence

texts.en: Ruphence is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal and firewood. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with lots of clients and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a moto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy tailoring materials to enable her to make more clothes. Her business goal is to open more business branches all over the country within five years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open other branches.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials to enable her to make more clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional stylish jewelry items for her husband's artificial jewelry business

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a married woman. She has six children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy materials to construct a business stall she wants to open in a different area. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a leader in supplying vegetables. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a business stall

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en: Melisa is a married woman. She has two children who are five and eight years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Jennibe

texts.en:
Jennibe is 29 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Jennibe is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jennibe requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennibe has been in pig fattening for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennibe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emely

texts.es: Emely  una joven de 23 años egresada en la carrera de Enfermera Técnica. Actualmente se encuentra estudiando su segunda profesión de Farmacia y Bioquímica pasando a su tercer ciclo lo cual le va bien. Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo y la confianza brindada. Su mayor deseo es obtener su título profesional y poner una farmacia. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de su pensión y matricula. Emely agradece a los inversionistas kiva que hicieron posible este crédito.
texts.en: Emely is 23 years old and has a degree in nursing. She is currently studying for a second degree in pharmacology and biochemistry. She is now in third semester, and the course is going well. She is grateful to her parents for the trust put in her. Emely’s biggest dream is to finish her degree and open a pharmacy. This loan will be used to pay rent and tuition fees. Emely is grateful to Kiva lenders for making this loan possible.

loans.use: to pay rent and tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients for preparing and selling fried snacks.

loans.name: Frady Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Frady es un mecánico de motos y carros muy experimentado. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.
Adicional a su labor como mecánico también tiene un pequeño almacén de venta de repuestos automotrices en el cual ofrece distintos tipos de repuestos en diferentes marcas.
Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.
El solicita un préstamo para surtir su almacén con gran cantidad de repuestos, de este modo podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes
texts.en:
Frady is a very experienced motorcycle and car mechanic. He has developed many skills as a result of studying at different schools and from on-the-job learning.

In addition to his work as a mechanic, Frady also has a shop where he sells different brands of spare parts for vehicles.

Frady is very hard-working and honest. He knows the importance of the vehicles to their owners and so always tries to offer good quality, efficient service.

Frady is applying for this loan in order to stock up his shop with a large number of spare parts in order to have them available for customers.

loans.use: to stock up on spare parts for cars and motorcycles.

loans.name: Awaskira Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras: Norma Yesenia, Alicia y Cindy Lorena, que tienen una pequeña pulpería en un tramo que alquilan en uno de los mercados de Bilwi. Las tres se han propuesto luchar para hacer crecer sus negocios, con el deseo de llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida personal y de sus familias; se organizaron hace 8 meses para poder acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. El nombre del grupo solidario AWASKIRA, es del vocablo miskito que significa tierra de pinares.

Con el primer crédito recibido de Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, les permitió  a Norma Yesenia, Alicia incrementar los productos de su pulpería, sus ingresos ha ido mejorando porque ahora ha diversificado sus actividades, elaboran enchiladas, tacos y venden frijoles cocidos.  

CINDY LORENA: Es nueva integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven de 19 años de emprendedora, soltera, con deseos de superarse y  de apoyar a su mama con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hermanos. Desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos básicos. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chivería, sopas instantáneas, pan, huevo, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members, Norma, Alicia and Cindy, who have small grocery shops at stalls that they rent from one of the markets in Bilwi. The three women are working hard to expand their businesses in order for them and their families to be able to enjoy a higher quality life. Eight months ago the women came together to apply for a loans through Pana Pana. The group is called “Awaskira”, meaning “land of pine groves” in the Miskito language.

The group’s first loan from Pana Pana that was financed from Kiva allowed Norma and Alicia to increase stock at their groceries stores. Their incomes steadily increased because they have diversified their work, now also producing enchiladas and tacos and selling cooked beans.

Cindy is a new member to the loan group. She is 19 years old, single, and an enterprising woman with a desire to do better and support her mother with household costs, as well as her siblings’ education. Three years ago she opened a small grocery shop where she sells staple goods. She is applying for her first loan in order to buy basic grains, dairy products, instant soups, bread, eggs, fizzy drinks and other products. Cindy’s dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, instant soups, bread, eggs, fizzy drinks and other products.

loans.name: Cecilia Maria

texts.es:
Cecilia es una madre cabeza de familia, soltera de 37 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, un hombre de 19 años, dos mujeres de 15 y 8 años de edad.
Cecilia para generar los recursos necesarios para alimentación, estudio de sus hijos, pago de cuentas de servicios públicos, y otras gastos que resultan en el día a día, se apoya en su negocio de confección, que inicio como una necesidad económica.
Entre sus sueños más locos esta comprar una vivienda propia, se la llama loco por que son personas con ingresos modestos, pero que han ido cambiando con el apoyo de una entidad como interactuar que junto con su aliado Kiva, andan revolucionando dichos pensamientos.
Cecilia quiere seguir siendo el soporte de sus hijos, ofrecerles estudios, mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, por ello solicita un préstamo para darle un impulso a su negocio el cual invertirá, en la compra de una maquina fileteadora con el propósito de agilizar sus tiempos de producción y mejorar sus tiempos de entrega
texts.en:
Cecilia is a single female who is a head of household.  She is 37 years old and has three children -  a young man who is 19, and two young ladies aged 15 and 8. Cecilia, to generate the resources needed to feed her children and put them through school, and to pay the utility bills and other expenses that manifest from day to day, relies on her business of constructing clothing, which she began out of economic necessity.
Among Cecilia's wildest dreams is to purchase her own home, which is considered to be crazy,  because they (her family) are people with modest incomes.  Cecilia's family has been changing with the support of an organization: Interactuar, which, together with its ally Kiva, is changing these types of thinking.

Cecilia wants to continue her support of her children, to provide education, to improve the conditions of their home, and is requesting a loan to give a boost to her business.  She will invest in buying an overlock sewing machine in order to expedite production and improve delivery times.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Las solidarias” y está conformada por 05 mujeres trabajadoras dispuestas a comenzar a trabajar. Rosmery de 19 años  es soltera, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de frutas. Hace más de un año que ella se viene dedicando a dicho negocio el cual le va bien. Su crédito lo destinará para la compra de naranjas, peras, manzanas y plátanos. El deseo de Rosmery es seguir prosperando en su negocio. El nuevo grupo “las solidarias” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Rosmery es la tercera del lado derecho y viste blusa negra.
texts.en: This is the new group “Las solidarias” (Solidarity), which consists of five working women who are willing to get started. Rosmery,  19 years old, is single.  Currently, she sells fruit. She has been in this business, which is doing well, for over a year. Her loan will be used for the purchase of oranges, pears, apples and bananas. Rosmery's desire is to continue to thrive in her business. The new group “Las solidarias” (Solidarity) thanks the people who made this loan. Rosmery is the third from the right and is wearing a black blouse.

loans.use: to buy oranges, pears, apples and bananas.

loans.name: Nohora Ruth

texts.es:
Nohora es una mujer solitaria, de 51 años de edad, propietaria de una tienda de abarrotes, pero con el ánimo y espíritu muy decaído, solo trabaja para producir lo suficiente para vivir, comer lo necesario, tener lo necesario, una persona con pocas aspiraciones en la vida.
Ella es residente de la zona de montería, un sitio muy golpeado por la pobreza, donde escasean las oportunidades, y donde rige la desigualdad.
Con la llegada de Interactuar a esta zona, la mentalidad de muchos micro-empresarios está cambiando, les ofrecen proyectos y oportunidades que los ilusionan con una mejor vida, aspirar a mejores cosas, a que no tiene que vivir una vida mediocre, y Nohora quiere aprovechar estas buenas intenciones que tienen con ellos, Solicitando un prestando para la compra de surtido de granos, abarrotes, como frijol, arroz, lentejas, pastas, aceite, panela entre otros.
texts.en:
Nohora is a single woman, who is 51 years old and the owner of a grocery store.  However, with diminishing encouragement and very flagging spirits, Nohora only works to produce enough to live, to eat what one must.  Nohora is a person with few aspirations in life. She is a resident of the Montería area, which is a region that has been hard-hit by poverty, a place where opportunities are scarce and where inequality rules.

With the arrival of Interactuar in this area, the mentality of many micro-entrepreneurs is changing. Interactuar offers them projects and opportunities that have led them to hope for a better life, to aspire to better things, to not have to live a mediocre life.  Nohora wants to take advantage of these good intentions which they brought with them.  She is applying for a loan for the purchase of assorted grains and groceries, such as beans, rice, lentils, pasta, oil, and brown sugar, among other products.

loans.use: to purchase assorted grains and groceries, such as beans, rice, lentils, pasta, oil, and brown sugar, among other products.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: María, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y reside con ellos en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Mezapa, Atlántida, cerca al municipio de Yoro. Ella inicio con la venta de ropa en general como blusas, pantalones, ropa para niños, camisetas, ropa interior y vestidos. Esta mercadería la vendía de manera ambulante hace dos y a medida fue creciendo, decidió establecer una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, manteca, huevos, refrescos, pan, churros, jugos, etc. Actualmente sigue con la venta de ropa, vende útiles escolares, un poco de cosméticos y su pulpería. Lleva el segundo ciclo de préstamo en la institución y es por 20,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar cuadernos, mochilas, lápices, colores para esta época escolar y más productos alimenticios, refrescos, churros, azúcar, frijoles, harina, huevos, lácteos y ropa para vender.  Su plan es crecer con el negocio y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en: María is a 40-year-old single mother of four children.  She lives with them in a village in the municipality of Mezapa, Atlántida, near the town of Yoro. María started selling clothes such as blouses, pants, children's clothing, shirts, underwear and dresses. She was selling this merchandise as a street vendor 2 and 1/2 years ago, and as the business grew, decided to establish a grocery store where she sells food products such as rice, sugar, butter, eggs, soda, bread, churros (doughnuts), juices, etc. She still sells clothes, school supplies, and some cosmetics together with running her grocery store.  María is taking her second loan with the institution, which is for 20,000 lempiras.  With this money, she will buy notebooks, backpacks, pencils, crayons, and more food products including soft drinks, (doughnuts), sugar, beans, flour, eggs and milk, in addition to more clothing to sell. Her plan is to grow the business and to continue moving upward, together with her children.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, backpacks, pencils, crayons, and more food products including soft drinks, (doughnuts), sugar, beans, flour, eggs and milk, in addition to more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Francis Rosario

texts.es:
Francis de 59 años de edad, es originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región, casada con hijos mayores de edad, los cuales son independiente económicamente, esta mujer se ha caracterizado por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, en la cual en la actualidad se ha propuesto metas y objetivos   los que  ha cumplido gracias a la disciplina, y perseverancia con su trabajo, el cual es su fuente de ingreso.
 En la actualidad, sigue luchando  por ver mejorado su negocio, ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de calzado variado al detalle y al por mayor, en un lugar específico de unos de los mercado de la localidad, tiene veinte años de dedicarse a dicho negocio  y gracias a su experiencia ha sobrevivido a tanta competencia tanto en calidad  y precios, y ese ha sido unos de sus mayores retos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con mercadería como: zapatos de cuero, deportivos, tenis, sandalias, zapatos de niños  y en este momento quiere aprovechar la temporada de la entrada de clases de niños, jóvenes, universitarios por lo tanto existe una mayor demanda del producto. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Francis agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Francis, 59 years old, is from Managua, a place located in the region's central area.

She is married and has children of legal age who are economically independent. Francis is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman determined to get ahead. Thanks to discipline and perseverance in her work (her only income source), she has achieved the goals and objectives she set for herself.

Currently, she is still striving to see her business improve. Her economic activity consists of selling assorted footwear in bulk as well as in retail, in a store at one of the local markets. She has 20 years of experience in this business and thanks to that, she has outlived so much competition both in quality and price. This has been one of her biggest challenges.

The purpose of this loan is to increase her working capital and restock her business with leather shoes, sports shoes, tennis shoes, sandals and children's shoes. Right now, she wants to seize the 'back to school' moment when kids, teenagers and college students return to their classes and therefore there is a greater demand for the product.

She devotes about ten hours a day to her business selling her products, so that she can make more profits in the near future.

Francis thanks Kiva lenders for the help they provide to people of limited resources to have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy footwear such as leather shoes, sports shoes, tennis shoes, sandals and children's shoes.

loans.name: Thức

texts.en:
Mrs Thức operates a food stall selling fish. Thức has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Thức is 44 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Thức joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thức has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thức faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thức hopes for her children to do well in school, for her children to find a good job, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a retail business where she makes detergents to sell. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of chemicals for preparing detergents. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of chemicals for preparing detergents.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has 5 children. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a vehicle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a market oriented place and his primary customers are individuals. 

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to service his vehicle. His business goal is to have several vehicles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to better his life.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman with three children who describes herself to be determined. She operates a beauty salon located in a good area and her primary customers are private individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as not having sufficient stock of beauty products. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more stock. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita works hard to support her family. Julita is widowed and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Julita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Julita has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Julita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 54 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school. 

Linda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Linda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Linda has been raising pigs for twenty years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Linda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Catheline

texts.en:
Catheline is a married woman with seven children, all of whom do not attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 13 years, selling mats in the market and to the community. She mentioned competition and seasonality as a major challenge 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase weaving materials for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for her husband to manufacture iron accessories.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik happily lives in the village Tsovagyugh of Gegharkunik region with his wife and small daughter. Garnik is a skilled and experienced driver, for many years he worked as a driver at different workshops and private companies, but the last seven years he has been fully engaged in farming and agriculture. Now he is already connoisseur in his farm affairs. 

In his farm Garnik has cows, calves, bulls and sheep. His plot of land gives a perfect harvest of potatoes, tomatoes and cucumber. So milk, meat and some assortment of vegetables which Garnik sells at the city’s wholesale market and mainly to re-sellers. Garnik suggests that since establishing his farm he must make it larger year by year. Of course now he has no finances for cattle purchase, but he is happy to find out that Kiva lenders can help him in this case. 

This loan, of an amount of 600,000 Armenian drams, he will use for the purchase of one more cow and also animal fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also animal fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles de 50 años de edad, es originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región,  es casada, con tres hijos mayores de edad independiente económicamente, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus familiares, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no  pudo estudiar, y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar, para aportar económicamente con los gastos de hogar.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta de llantas de vehículos, actividad que la desempeña desde hace doce años, y está ubicado en su casa de habitación,  su rutina de trabajo es de unas ocho horas diarias, para mantener su clientela y hacer crecer ofreciendo un buen servicio. El objetivo del crédito es invertiré en capital de trabajo para la compra de llantas de vehículos de diferentes tipos como: llantas de carros, llantas de tractor, llantas de bicicletas, llantas de camionetas, de motos, llantas de implemento agrícolas. Y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes  y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles is 50 years old. She is from Managua, a city in the central area of Leon region.

She is married and has three children of legal age who are economically independent. She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman with an attitude towards personal growth. In her spare time, she likes to enjoy the company of her family.

Sadly, for lack of economical resources, she couldn't study and had to work to help with the home expenses.

Thanks to her will to get ahead, she has a tyre business located in her house as her economic activity, an activity she has had for twelve years. She has an eight-hour work schedule during which she offers good service to maintain and increase her clientele.

The purpose of this loan is to increase the working capital to buy tyres for different types of vehicles such as cars, tractors, bicycles, vans, motorcycles and agricultural machinery. This way she will be able to meet her customers demands and increase her income in the near future.

María thanks Kiva lenders for the help they provide to people of limited resources from poor countries like Nicaragua to have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy tyres for cars, tractors, bicycles, vans, motorcycles and agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL LAS MARÍAS ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES, SEIS MUJERES Y DOS HOMBRES, MADREES Y PADRES DE FAMILIA  RESPONSABLE DE QUINCE HIJOS, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE NORTE DE LA REGIÓN,  TODOS TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS. LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR  Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD,  
GRACIAS A  SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES  MAUDA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UN BAR  Y COMEDOR  UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS  SERVICIOS CON LA VENTA DE DIFERENTES PLATOS CASEROS DE COMIDA, Y JUGOS Y GASEOSAS A CLIENTES FIJOS COMO SON LOS ESTUDIANTES Y TRABAJADORES DE LA ZONA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO  Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO  CON LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLE PARA ELABORAR LOS DIFERENTE PLATILLOS COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZÚCAR, PAN, CARNE, POLLO, HUEVOS, VERDURAS, CONDIMENTOS, PLATOS DESCARTABLES, JUGOS, GASEOSAS. ETC. LAS MARÍAS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Las Marías is made up of eight members, six women and two men, mothers and fathers responsible for fifteen children. They are from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region. All of them have different work. Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources, they could not go to school, and they saw the need to work from an early age. 

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Mauda and she has a bar and restaurant located in her house. She works in her business some twelve hours daily, offering her services  with the sale of different homemade dishes, and juices and soft drinks, to regular customers who are students and workers in the area. The objective for the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase of food products to make the different dishes such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, meat, chicken, eggs, vegetables, seasonings, disposable plates, juices, soft drinks, etc. Las Marías is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, meat, chicken, eggs, vegetables, seasonings, disposable plats, juices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Kiteme

texts.en: Kiteme is a married man with two children aged six and 12. He describes himself to be ambitious. Kiteme has been operating a retail business for three years, where he sells sugar, bread, flour, washing soap and other household items. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the 100,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more stock of household items. His business goal is to expand into a supermarket within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business will grow and be able to employ other people. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more household items to sell

loans.name: Feri

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Fery. Fery lives in the eastern part of Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He joined Ruma four years ago and this is the second time he is asking for a loan from Kiva. He owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone accessories and provides mobile payment services. After four years joining Ruma, he learned many things about how to improve his business. 

As his business grows, Fery is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Fery improve his business and accordingly, to his community, who need access to such services. As seen in the photo, Fery is the one who is standing at his own stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman who has one child and describes herself as ambitious. She runs a restaurant where she is the cook. For three years, she has been operating this business in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more stock of ingredients for her restaurant. Her business goal is to have a prestigious hotel within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Iniwaska Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras (FLORENTINA SANDRA, MARIA AUXILIADORA y NAYSI MARIA) de la etnia miskita, viven en la comunidad de Wawa Boon, río que conecta a la población por vía terrestre de las cabeceras departamentales de Puerto Cabezas, Waspam, de la Región Autónoma de la Costa Caribe Norte a través de la movilización por medio del lanchón (que es una barcaza construida de hierro, funciona como ferry que traslada a los vehículos y población de una orilla a otra) para transportarlos al  Triángulo Minero y Región del Pacifico. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos e incrementar el inventario de sus productos, se organizaron hace 2 semanas para tener acceso a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Son mujeres que luchan día a día con el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias y asegurar la educación de sus pequeños.

NAYSI MARIA: Es una joven cordial de 20 años de edad, coordinadora del grupo solidario. Desde hace 5 años estableció su pequeña pulpería en su casa de tambo de manera, con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus 4 hermanos adolescentes, que quedaron bajo su responsabilidad al fallecer su mama. Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar: gaseosas, chiverías y productos básicos, así incrementar sus ingresos y pagar los estudios de sus hermanos y gastos del hogar. Ella sueña con tener una tienda de ropa y calzados.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three enterprising women (Florentina Sandra, Maria Auxiliadora, and Naysi Maria) who are of the Miskito ethnicity. They live in the community of Wawa Boon, a river that connects the population by land to the departmental capital of Puerto Cabezas, Waspam, in the autonomous region of Costa Caribe Norte, though going by barge (which is a barge made of iron, which functions as a ferry that transports the vehicles and people from one bank to the other) to transport them to Triángulo Minero and Región del Pacífico. With the goal of having their own source of income and increasing the inventory of their products, they organized two weeks ago to have access to loans with a solidarity guarantee in Pana Pana. They are women who struggle day by day with the desire to improve their families' living conditions and assure their little ones' education. 

Naysi Maria is a cordial young woman, 20 years old, the coordinator of the solidarity group. Five years ago, she established a small grocery store in her stilt house, with the goal of getting her four adolescent siblings ahead, who are under her responsibility due to the death of their mother. She is asking for her first loan to purchase soft drinks, snacks, and basic products, in this way increasing her income and paying for her siblings' education and household expenses. She dreams of having a clothing and shoe store.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, snacks and basic products.

loans.name: Radzhabmoh

texts.en:
Radzhabmoh is a generous woman. She was born in 1960. She is living in a remote district. She is a widow. She has four children. She is raising her children alone. 

Her son supports her to do a business. For about five years she has done a business of planting agricultural products. Radzhabmoh works hard and loves her activity. She takes a good harvest from plants. She sells her products at a domestic market. She has a great number of satisfied clients every day.

She is renovating her house now, but the money that she saved up could not cover all the expenditures of renovation. She needs to buy additional materials to finish her renovation. Radzhabmoh is requesting financial support from Kiva to buy construction materials. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sakhale's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Mai 2011,est constitué de 19 membres qui habitent dans la même localité.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Kédiakhou,se trouvant debout a droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois garçons et deux filles.Elle effectue le commerce comme activité principale.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter des condiments d'une valeur de 50000f,02 sacs de riz à 25000f,04 sacs d'arachide à 30000f, 10 bouteilles de 5l d'huiles à 55000f, de l'huile de palme d'une valeur de 30000f et le reste constitue  les frais de transport.

Pour son bénéfice,elle désire augmenter son épargne,subvenir a ces besoins et assurer l'éducation de ces enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2011 and is made up of 19 members who live in the same neighbourhood. Their principal activity is commerce.

Kediakhou, who is standing on the right in the photo with her arm raised, is our featured borrower. She is married with five children, of whom three are boys and two are girls. Her main activity is commerce.

With her loan, she plans to buy condiments for 50000 f, two sacks of rice at 25000f, four sacks of groundnuts at 30000f, 10 bottles of five litres of oil at 55000f, 30000f worth of palm oil, and the rest represents the transport costs.

For her profit, she would like to increase her savings, provide for her needs, and guarantee her children's education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Na Bintou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée en Mai 2011,est constitué de 13 membres qui habitent tous dans la même localité. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Khadija,se trouvant assis à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle est mariée et mére de six enfants dont quatre garçons et deux filles.Elle effectue le commerce de vêtements comme activité principale.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter des habits de prêt à porter d'une valeur de 90000f.

Pour son bénéfice,elle souhaite renforcer son épargne et renouveler son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2011 and is made up of 13 members who live in the same neighbourhood. Their principal activity is commerce.

Khadija, who is sitting on the right in the photo with her arm raised, is our star borrower. She is married with six children, four of whom are boys and two are girls. Her main activity is selling clothing.

With her loan, she plans to buy ready-to-wear clothing worth 90000f.

For her profit, she would like to increase her savings, and renew her business assets.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as high cost of products. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in Guihulngan, the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Lorna has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from selling fruits. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old and single. 

Maria is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maria has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Mery Rose

texts.en:
Mery Rose is 20 years old, married, and has two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mery Rose has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alex Xavier

texts.es:
El Joven Alex de 22  años de edad, vive con sus padres en casa se dedica desde hace 5 años al oficio como carpintero en su taller elaboran puertas, mezas, cómodas, chineros, gaveteros, espejos de lujo, camas y arreglos de todo tipo hechos de madera.
Alex vive en el municipio de San Lorenzo al  sur de Honduras, es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como: madera, sellador, pintura, etc. con este préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir  trabajando  con Prisma.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio y llegar a tener uno de los mejores talleres de carpintería de la zona.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
Alex is a 22-year-old young man. He lives with his parents at home and has worked for 5 years in the carpentry trade, and in his workshop they make doors, tables, chests of drawers, china cabinets, cabinets, luxury mirrors, beds, and repairs to all sorts of wooden products. 

Alex lives in the municipality of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. He is an enterprising man with desires to improve his quality of life. He is asking for the loan to purchase raw materials such as wood, sealer, paint, etc. and, with this loan, he plans to improve his income and his quality of life. He is a client with desires to continue working with Prisma.

His dream is to grow with his business and to have one of the best carpentry shops in the zone. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January 2015.

loans.use: to purchase wood, sealer, paint, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Yener

texts.es:
Yener tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de San Felipe que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se realizan en este distrito son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, además se dedica al cultivo de maíz, yuca, etc. Cuenta con experiencia en este sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con esto Yener espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yener is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and lives with his spouse and their child in the district of San Felipe, which is located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The principal activities that people do in this district are agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry. 

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, and also grows corn, yucca, etc. He has experience in this sector and has many good personal and work references in the zone. The loan will be destined to invest in the purchase of manure and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop. With this, Yener hopes to offer a better quality coffee to his customers, which will allow him to generate more income and, in the end, will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of manure and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es:
Salomon tiene 57 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico; tiene tres hijas menores de edad que estudian en la escuela, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de frutales, café y arroz, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno para posteriormente engordarlo y comercializarlo en una zona donde se reúnen ganaderos de los caseríos aledaños. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Salomon espera incrementar su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Salomon is 57 years old, lives in his own house made of rustic material, has three daughters who are minors and got to school, and lives in a rural zone of Pucará district, a community which works in agriculture, specifically growing fruit trees, coffee and rice, located in Jaén province, which is part of Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

He works raising cattle to later fatten them and sell them in a zone where the cattle growers from the nearby villages gather. He has asked for a loan to purchase a greater number of cattle to increase the stock in his business. With this, Salomon hopes to increase the level of sales, with the end of increasing his level of income and with the end of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater number of livestock to increase the stock in his business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 9 years. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells goats. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as drought. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of goats. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goats.

loans.name: Maricho

texts.en:
Maricho, 40, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maricho has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Maricho has been in this business for eight years.

Maricho requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Maricho would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 51 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a bicycle taxi.

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the living conditions of her house, making a division between the kitchen and living room for more comfort.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 57, married and has three adult-age children. She has owned and managed a small retail store within the local community for almost three years. 

Due to financial hardship, she aspires to improve her business in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to ask an additional PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to improve her business more.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Anyi Lisseth

texts.es:
La Joven Anyi de 25  años de edad, vive con sus padres  se dedica desde hace 1  años al negocio de venta de ropa  usada, vende pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, biquinis, etc.
Anyi vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de ropa usada como pantalones, vestidos, faldas, blusas, camisas, etc. Espera con esta inversión surtir más su negocio y así obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.  
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del 2015
texts.en: Anyi is 25 years old and lives with her parents. For a year she has started the business of selling used clothes. She sells pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, leggings, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, bikinis, etc. Anyi lives in the city of San Lorenzo Valle, on the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman who wishes to move ahead, and who struggles day by day to improve her quality of life. She is requesting a loan to buy used clothes such as pants, dresses, skirts, blouses, shirts, etc. She hopes to stock up her business more with this loan, and in this way obtain the needed income to move ahead with her family. Her dream is to have a good business and increase her customers, and at the same time together with her family, to improve her future.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, skirts, blouses, shirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Karla Group

texts.es: Karla es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, que lo coordina la señora Martha, quien tiene la edad de 42 años, casada, es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde pequeña creció en un ambiente de lo que es la agricultura y ganadería, y que ha logrado mantener principalmente lo que es la comercialización de leche, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de miel, desparasitante, gallinaza, etc., una de sus metas es ser una de las mayores proveedoras de leche. Los demás integrantes son, la señora Karla que tiene la edad de 34 años y es propietaria de un salón de belleza en su domicilio, además realiza trabajos a domicilio este negocio lo impulsó hace nueve años, y Magaly una señora que tiene la edad de 29 años y es propietaria de una panadería y tiene una experiencia de quince años.
texts.en: Karla is a supportive group, made up of three entrepreneurial women, coordinated by Martha. She is 42 years old, married, she is a hard-working woman who, since she was very young, grew up in an environment around agriculture and livestock. She has managed to develop mainly in the sale of milk. She is asking for the current loan to purchase honey, deworming medication, hen droppings, etc. One of her goals is to be one of the largest suppliers of milk. The other members are Karla, who is 34 years old, and is the owner of a beauty salon in her home, besides doing several jobs in people’s homes. She started this work 9 years ago. Magaly is 29 years old, she is the owner of a bakery, and she has 15 years of experience.

loans.use: to purchase honey, deworming medication, hen droppings, etc.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en: Severina is 45 years old and lives in Pagadian, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married  with 2 school-age children. When she was single, her parents taught farming and she treasures what she learned from them. She now has expertise in this kind of business. Today, she requests a loan to buy 8 sacks of fertilizers for more produce. In the future, Severina wants to provide for the financial needs of her children especially their studies.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of fertilizers.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 52 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Charity is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Charity has been pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jesusa works hard to support her family.

She has an animal sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Jesusa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Helen has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell rice business.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 55 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anecita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Anecita has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from selling fruits.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Alma has been in this business for 14 years. She earns extra income from buying and selling dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Maydra Jeaqueline

texts.es:
La señora Maydra de 34  años de edad, vive con su mama y sus hijas  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de tortillas, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y amistades quienes le prefieren por su buena atención y su buen producto.
Doña Maydra vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo valle  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Maydra está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña y cal que son la materia prima para elaborar sus productos, espera con esta inversión  mejoren sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es aumentar  su clientela para mejorar sus ingresos y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
Maydra is 34 years old, she lives with her mother and her daughters in a house that she owns. She has worked for 5 years in the sale of tortillas. Her clients are her neighbors and friends, who prefer her because of her good service and products. 
Maydra lives in the city of San Lorenzo valley, in the south of Honduras. She is a hard-working woman with the desire to get ahead, and she works hard every day to improve her quality of life. Maydra is asking for a loan to purchase maize, firewood, and lime, which are the raw materials to make her products. With this investment, she hopes her income will improve, and also her quality of life.
Her dream is to increase her clientele, to improve her income, and at the same time improve her future next to her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January 2015

loans.use: to purchase maize, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: To earn additional income, Josefa engages in a tailoring business within the local community. She is 44 years old and has four children attending school. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she would like to strengthen this business in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy threads, needles, fabric and buttons needed in her tailoring shop. She is hoping that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, fabric and buttons needed in her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Igloria

texts.en:
Igloria is 56 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three children. She has managed her carinderia (a local eatery) for ten years with the help of her husband. She has requested a loan to buy meat and spices for her business. 

Igloria has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she dreams of being a succesfull businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy meat and spices for her business.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 51 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three adult-aged children. 

Emeliana has managed her small eatery in their town and has had this business for six years. She requested a loan to buy kitchen utensils, meat and chicken for her eatery business. 

Emeliana has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Emeliana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, meat and chicken for her eatery

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino is managing his eatery business in Balangasan. He mastered the business when he and his wife were on the early years of their marriage. 

This business has been doing well, supporting the needs of Florentino's family. He has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, Florentino took a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business. He wants to expand his business and would be more than happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities, and earning as well for her family. 

As a member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

In the future, Carmelita wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District,  Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a responsible mother; she requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruit for retail. 

This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruit

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 26 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con su hijo en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado para damas, caballeros y niños, realiza esta actividad desde hace dos años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias peronales y laborales de ella. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ropa y calzado para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Roxana espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana is 26 years old, she is a single mother, and she lives in her parent’s house with her son in the district of Pucará, located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in this district is quiet, the citizens work mainly in agriculture, livestock, and sales.  
She works in the sale of clothing and footwear for women, men, and children. She has had this occupation for 2 two years, she has experience in the business, and loyal clients who have very good personal and work references for her. The loan will be used to purchase a larger quantity of clothing and footwear to increase the stock in her business. This way, Roxana hopes to offer a large variety of products to her clients, which will generate more income, and therefore increase her quality of life and of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of clothing and footwear to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is from Pagadian City. She is 66 years old and is married. Condrada owns and operates a sari-sari store in their barangay. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Condrada joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Condrada is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock and to use as additional working capital. This loan will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock and to use as additional working capital.

loans.name: Josias Ruel

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Josias Ruel is married and has children. He is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Josias Ruel works as a tailor, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. He uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as handstitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas for employees like Josias Ruel is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Josias Ruel is asking for your assistance to help him circumvent loan sharks. He has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from his paycheck. He is seeking a 13,000 PHP loan to get back his pawned ATM card.

Josias Ruel wants to give his family a better life someday. He looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labour force, equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Levita before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to redeem the ATM card that he pawned.

loans.name: Lilyn

texts.en:
Lilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lilyn has been in this business for 15 years. Lilyn earns more income from buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing.

Lilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 28 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melanie has a general store business in the Philippines. Melanie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, beers, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, beers, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Safari Group

texts.en:
Amina is in her early 30's, single, and has two children who attend school. She has a food stall where she sells local foods such as soup and chapati. She has had the food stall for about four years, and works from 5:30 am until 10 am and makes a minimal monthly profit. 

This is Amina's first loan from Tujijenge. She plans to use the loan to buy more supplies and ingredients so she can cook more dishes and improve her business. She hopes to earn more profit with this loan so she can continue to pay her children's school fees, and would love to be able to renovate her home. 

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Safari, which consists of six women who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more supplies and ingredients

loans.name: G.s San Francisco Group

texts.es: EL G.S SAN FRANCISCO ESTA CONFORMADO POR TRES HOMBRES, CASADOS CON SEIS HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER PRODUCTOR DE PRODUCTOS LÁCTEOS, Y CRIANZA DE CERDOS PARA EL DESTACE DE Y ELABORACIÓN DE COMIDA TÍPICA CON LA CARNE DEL CERDOS, ESTOS INTEGRANTES SON TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS HIJOS, LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS, SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR, EN LA ACTUALIDAD SON LOS PROVEEDORES DE SUS FAMILIAS, Y LUCHA DÍA  A DÍA PARA MANTENER SUS NEGOCIOS Y SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS.  EL COORDINADOR ES JOSE Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE CERDOS EN PIE, A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES. EL DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHO HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS.  EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE UN LOTE DE CERDOS EN PIE EL G.S SAN FRANCISCO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDA N A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Group San Francisco is made up of three men, married with six children under their care. They come from El Sauce, a place known for its dairy production and pig farming to fatten them and prepare typical dishes with their meat.

The group members are hardworking, responsible and determined to get ahead. In their spare time they like to enjoy the company of their children. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources, they couldn't study and had to start working young. Currently, they are the ones who provide for their families and they strive daily to keep their businesses going and support their children.

José is the group coordinator. He has a pig farming business, he fattens and sells live pigs to both regular and occasional customers. He devotes to his business eight hours a day selling his products. The purpose of this loan is to buy live pigs.

The group San Francisco thanks Kiva lenders for the help they provide to people of limited resources to have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy live pigs for fattening and selling.

loans.name: Keidy Joselin

texts.es:
La joven Keidy  de 21 años de edad, vive con sus padres  se dedica desde hace 2  años al negocio de venta de ropa  usada, vende pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, bresieres, biquinis, etc.
Keidy  vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de dos  fardos  de ropa como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, faldas, etc.  Con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del 2015
texts.en:
Keidy is a young woman who is 21 years old. She lives with her parents. She has worked for two years in the sale of second-hand clothing, she sells pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, spandex, T-shirts, dresses, skirts, bras, bikinis, etc. 
Keidy lives in the city of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman who wishes to get ahead and works hard every day to improve her quality of life. 
She is asking for a loan to purchase two bundles of clothing, such as blouses, dresses, pants, shirts, skirts, etc. With the help of this loan, she wants to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a client who wants to keep working with Prisma. 
Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele and at the same time, improve her future next to her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, January 2015

loans.use: to purchase blouses, dresses, pants, shirts, skirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon owns and manages her retailing business in Pagadian City. Being a member of PMPC, she diligently pays all of her obligations from the earnings of her shop. 

Recently, Corazon applied for a loan to purchase additional stock for her glass and aluminum business. 

Corazon wishes to earn more doing this type of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her glass and aluminum business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Grezelda

texts.en:
Grezelda is 35 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with only one child. 

Grezelda has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business earning approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Grezelda has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business. 

Grezelda has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a businesswoman who earns by retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently she applied a loan for a kitchen renovation. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to pay for a kitchen renovation

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

Celedonia has applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to increase her tailoring services

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies for her business.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Eppie

texts.en:
Eppie is from Cavite, Philippines. She is married and they have a child. She has been employed in a garment factory in Cavite for three years now through the help of the CCT (Covenant Community Service Cooperative*).

Eppie works as a seamstress. She does the sewing and designing of clothing apparel according to the company or client’s demand. She sews clothes using a sewing machine or other stitching machine, and often does hand stitching of edges and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Eppie, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Eppie is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying it since the loan payment was being deducted every pay day.  She looks forward for your positive response and any coming amount from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan to get back her pawned ATM card.

Eppie hopes to give her child good and quality education. She meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.
