She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelie is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelie has been in this business for two years now and also earns additional income from fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old and has six children. Virginia is a married woman.

Virginia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Moisesa

texts.en:
Moisesa is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Moisesa is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

Moisesa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Moisesa requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Moisesa has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Moisesa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 29 years old and has three children. Rosalie is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalie has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman who lives with her children at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling goat meat to the people in the community. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and theft in her business. 

With the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a hardworking man who wants a loan to buy a deep freezer. He runs a retail shop and rentals to generate income. He has been in business for 3 years. He started the business with the purpose of catering for his family's needs. He wishes to educate his children although he is challenged by inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a hardworking woman who wants a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar, salt and soap to sell. She runs a retail shop selling all kinds of general items. She started the business to cater for her family's needs, especially educating her children. She wishes to expand her business; however, inadequate capital is the biggest challenge affecting her dream.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Alban

texts.en:
Alban is 25 years old and married with two children. He is very hardworking, working in both construction and owning his own fast food shop. He has been in the fast food business for a very long time and is very satisfied with the income he generates from it, especially as his construction work is not enough for him to provide for his family. 

Now, he is in need of a loan in order to purchase a new refrigerator for his fast food shop and some other materials. This loan will help him to be able to continue to improve his business. He hopes in the future that his wife will also be able to find a job, or that he will be able to open a larger restaurant and hire his wife to work. He appreciates the help and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for his fast food shop and some other materials

loans.name: Amigos De La Zona Q Group

texts.es: Esta es la Nueva Alcancía “Los Amigos de la zona Q”, el cual  está constituido por 6 personas con muchos deseos de prosperar en su negocio. Gloria de 43 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica  a la venta de bebidas. Hace 02 años que emprendió dicho negocio el cual le va bien.  Su mayor deseo es poner una bodega de abarrotes. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, agua mineral y frugos. La Nueva Alcancía “los amigos de la zona Q” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitarles este crédito. Gloria es la tercera del lado  derecho y viste polo celeste.
texts.en: This is the new communal bank “Los Amigos de la zona Q” [Friends from Zone Q], which is made up of six people with the strong desire to prosper in their businesses.  Gloria is 43 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  She makes a living selling beverages.  Two years ago, she started this business, which is doing well.  Her greatest wish is to start a small grocery store.  She requested the loan to purchase sodas, mineral water and fruit juices.  The communal bank thanks the Kiva investors for providing them with this loan.  Gloria is the third from the right wearing the light blue shirt.

loans.use: to sell beverages

loans.name: Dilcia Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Dilcia de 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 3  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería y vive en un municipio de  al sur de Honduras.
Doña Dilcia es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería con arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, harina, salsas, avena, pan, churros, frescos, jugos, embutidos, huevos, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
Dilcia is 44 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house.  For 3 years, she has made a living with her grocery store business and lives in a municipality in southern Hounduras.

Dilcia is a hardworking woman with the desire to move forward in life and strives each and every day to improve her quality of life.  She is requesting the loan to purchase products to stock her store with rice, sugar, beans, shortening, flour, sauces, oats, bread, chips, sodas, juices, sliced meats, eggs, etc.  With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her income, as well as her quality of life.  She is a new client who wants to work with Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January 2015.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, shortening, flour, sauces, oats, bread, chips, sodas, juices, sliced meats, eggs, etc. for her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica al cultivo y comecialización de lima, con una antigüedad en el negocio de 30 años, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de lima para su posterior comercialización. Con ello Francisca espera mejorar su producción y por ende obtener mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is 54 years old. She lives in her own house, which is made of rustic materials, in the district of Pucara, which is located in the province of Jaen in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in this district is peaceful. The people there work primarily in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.

She makes a living cultivating and selling lime. She has been in this business for 30 years. She relies on very good personal and professional references in the area. She is requesting a loan to buy compost and fertilizer for the maintenance of her lime crops and their subsequent sale. With this loan, Francisca hopes to improve her production and, therefore, obtain a better income, which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer for the maintenance of her lime crops and their subsequent sale.

loans.name: Blesila

texts.en:
Blesila is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Blesila is 39 years old now.

Blesila has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Blesila has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman and has two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Rehema has operated a tailoring business for the past ten years. Her potential clients are ladies and gentlemen. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Ksh 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Gisela Carolina

texts.es:
Portoviejo capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo, ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señorita Gisela, tiene 29  años de edad y es soltera, viven con sus padres en casa propia.
Doña Gisela se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos por catálogo y también tiene una salón de eventos que está disponible para contratos de todos tipo, la venta de ropa y zapatos las realiza diariamente recorriendo puerta a puerta durante seis horas de lunes a viernes,  y que la sala de eventos la atienda el fin de semana, ella atiende sola sus negocios y le va muy bien, le gusta mucho  estas actividades.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar zapatos y ropa para la temporada playera. Lleva  tres años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta que el grupo sea responsable y el apoyo que recibe con los créditos y el seguro médico.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the Manabi province in Ecuador. This area is known for being the first, and therefore the oldest, Ecuadorian city to be established in the coastal region. It is gaining ground in the area of tourism, since it has a beach, a city, and a countryside.

In this place lives Gisela, who is 29 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in their own house. She makes a living selling clothing and shoes by catalog. She also has an events hall that is available for rent for all types of events. She carries out her clothing and shoe sales on a daily basis, going door to door for 6 hours Monday through Friday. She attends to her events hall on the weekends. She manages her businesses alone, and she does very well. She really enjoys her work.

She is requesting a loan to buy shoes and clothing for the beach season. She has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years. She likes that the group is responsible, and she appreciates the help that she receives with the loans and health insurance.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina, who is in her late 30s, is a widow with two daughters who are still at school. She has been selling small dry fish for ten years now. She works from 7:30 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Celina's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the fish stock and has successfully paid back all her loans. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees saved some in the bank and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to increase on the dry small fish stock and meet her customer's demand.  She dreams of opening a retail shop. Celina will make sure she pays the loan at the scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase on the dry small fish stock and meet her customer's demand.

loans.name: Denis Jeovany

texts.es:
El señor Denis de 36  años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 5  años a su trabajo como vendedor ambulante de zapatos por mayor y por menor, sus clientes son personas de los diferentes municipios de la zona.
Don Denis sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su comunidad y zonas  aledaña a esta, vive en el municipio de Pespire  al  sur de Honduras, es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de 6 docenas de zapato escolar ya que comienza la temporada escolar y los zapatos se venden bastante,   con este préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de  trabajar  con Prisma de Honduras.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio y llegar a tener una fábrica de Zapatos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
Denis is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own house.  For 5 years, he has made a living as a street vendor selling shoes at the wholesale and retail levels.  His clients are his neighbors and friends from his community and neighboring areas.  He lives in the Pespire municipality in southern Honduras.

Denis is a hardworking man with the desire to improve his quality of life.  He is requesting the loan to purchase six dozen school shoes, as the school season has started and the shoes are selling well.  With this loan, he hopes to improve his income and quality of life.  He is a new client who wants to work with Prisma of Honduras.  His dream is to grow his business and to own a shoe factory.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for his business

loans.name: Helah

texts.en:
Helah is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Helah requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Helah has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Helah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been able to look after his family and educate his children from his livestock business, alongside farming. Prolonged drought, foot and mouth diseases and inadequate capital are his main problems, however, he hopes to become a prominent business man.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more animals for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more animals for fattening.

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen lives alone in Kapan city of Syunik region. He is married but now all his family members live in different places; his wife is in the Russian Federation working there, their elder son is married and he lives with his family separately, and their smallest son lives and works in Yerevan. 

Vazgen has no higher education and for many years he worked at the Kapan Combine as a locksmith. Now, Vazgen has run his own small business and has been doing so for 15 years. He has a track of his own and he makes cargo transfers by order from Kapan to Yerevan and back. 

Vazgen needs this loan, since he has now some health problems and he needs to undergo a medical examination to find out the cause of his weakness and ill health. He thanks you in advance and hopes to have Kiva's support as soon as it is possible.

loans.use: to undergo a medical examination to find out the cause of his weakness

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis le 20 Mai 2003, les femmes de ce BV sont solidaire entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Maïmouna, (assise à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 02 enfants dont 01 garçon et 01 fille et âgée de 60 ans. Elle est vendeuse de petit déjeuné, de jus de fruits de soupe et de bouillie au mil  et au riz.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sacs de niébé à 15000f le sac de 50 kg, de l’oseille sèche, 05 sacs de mil à 10000 f le sac de l’huile et des condiments.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Created on May 20, 2003, the women of the 'banc villageois' have solidarity amongst them. Their main work involves commerce. 

Ms. Maïmouna (sitting at the far right) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of two (a boy and a girl), and she is 60 years old. She is a vendor of breakfasts, fruit juices, soups, and porridge of millet or rice. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase five 50-kg sacks of black-eyed peas at 15,000 francs per sack; some dried hibiscus flowers; five sacks of millet at 10,000 francs per sack; some oil; and condiments.

With the profits, she plans on building up her savings.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of black-eyed peas; some dried hibiscus flowers; five sacks of millet; some oil; and condiments.

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.en:
Mosharif is a young, kind and beautiful woman. She was born in 1971. She is an experienced person of almost about ten years. She is married and has two children, and lives with her family in a village.

Mosharif is busy with planting agricultural products in their yard. She is planting onion, carrot, peas and potatoes now. Every time she gets a good harvest from her plants, she sells her agricultural products in their domestic market. She has a large number of permanent clients. She is planning to buy fertilizer for her yard to make better plantings. She is needed some financial support to help realize her plans. Mosharif has requested a 1,000 Somoni loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Santos Florentino

texts.es:
El señor Santos de 55  años de  edad, vive en su casa propia junto con sus hermanos,  se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de muebles como, chineros, cómodas, camas, sillas, mezas, puertas, ventanas, etc. vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo  Valle, al sur de Honduras
Don Santos sus clientes son todos sus vecinos, amistades y personas de algunas casas comerciales, el se destaca por vender buenos artículos a buenos precios.
Don Santos es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar materia prima como madera, clavos, pegamento, mazonite, etc. son los productos más necesarios para la elaboración de sus chineros y demás productos.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del  2015.
texts.en:
Santos is 55 years old and lives in his own house with his two brothers.  For 10 years, he has made a living selling furniture such as china cupboards, chests, bed frames, chairs, tables, doors, windows, etc.  He lives in the city of San Lorenzo in the Valle area of southern Honduras.  His clients are his neighbors, friends and people from the commercial sector.  He stands out because he sells quality products at good prices.

Santos is a hardworking man with the desire to move forward.  He strives each and every day to improve his quality of life.  He is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials such as wood, nails, bonding, wooden particleboard, etc, as these are the most necessary materials to make his china cabinets and other products.  His dream is to grow his business and to improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January 2015

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, bonding, wooden particleboard, etc. for his business

loans.name: Roselily

texts.en: Roselily is 41 years old and a widow with two children. Because her children are in school, Roselily works especially hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including soap, milk, coffee, sugar, and eggs. She has been in her current line of work for four years and in the future would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alfreda is 54 years old now.

Alfreda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Alfreda requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Alfreda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Alfreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a small farmer from Siongiroi, Kenya. She is an adorable mother, and like many farmers in the region, keeps a dairy cow because Siongiroi has a thriving market for dairy products. Alice has sustained herself through this line of work for seven years, and enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes deep, to the extent that she names each of them. She hopes to expand her dairy farm but due to financial constraints has been unable to do this until now. Alice has requested a loan for Kes. 50,000 to buy a high-yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm and she will have more to consume and sell. With the money from the additional sales, she will also be able to pay her loan on time. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of supplies, but with a greater income, Alice will not have to take such measures and her family will enjoy an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with four school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga ( women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona works hard to support her family. Chona is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Chona requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business like fish nets and bamboo. Chona has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business like fish nets and bamboo.

loans.name: Binalyn

texts.en:
Binalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Binalyn has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Alayka Mae

texts.en:
Alayka Mae is 26 years old, married, and has two children attending school. She helps her husband in generating income through cooking and selling pizza, sandwiches, and other snack foods within their community.

She aimed to continue and improve this business but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for 50,000 PHP to buy cheese, flour, milk, sugar, eggs, and other ingredients she needs to cook food to sell.

Having this financial assistance, Alayka believes that someday she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hardworking man who sells alcohol and earns more income from rentals. He used the previous loan to buy more alcohol to sell.

Julius needs a credit facility to buy alcohol to sell. He started the business to generate more income to support his family. He is challenged by inadequate capital, together with high transport costs.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her farm equipment.

Rosemarie has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her farm equipment.

loans.name: Kako

texts.en:
Kako is a 20-year-old young man from the village of Velistsikhe. He lives with his pensioner grandmother and father, who is involved in a trading business. In particular, he buys fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and sells them in his district with price mark-ups. The business is the only source of income for the family, and that is really hardly enough for making financial stability.

In order to give help to his father and improve the living condition of his family, Kako decided to start his own agricultural activity. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions.

The startup program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2,100 GEL for setting up a poultry farm. He will buy chickens, breed them, and after growing, will sell them for a good price at the local market.

Kako will get the chance to make his own income and satisfy his family's increased needs. He will be very grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to set up a poultry farm and start an agribusiness.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman and has two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Mupa has operated a tailoring business for the past 6 years. Her potential clients are ladies and gentlemen. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Ksh 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various clothing items, jeans, shoes and other items.
